details:
FamilyHistory doesn't currently have a mechanism to capture when the family history was captured.  A family history that's 5 or 10 years old is less reliable than one that's only a few months old.  As well, where multiple family history records exist, there's a need to identify which one is the most current.

Recommendation: add "date" as an attribute to FamilyHistory and also add "date" as a search criteria for the resource.

summary: Address can't differentiate physical and postal
details: In the Location resource, there's a single Address element, however there's a use-case to have both a physical address and a mailing address (typically a PO box).  We could say that the mailing address is captured on the managingOrganization, but the same managingOrganization could be associated with multiple locations and it's possible the mailing address might vary by "Location"
i.e. what is the actual thing that goes in the fhirVersion slot?  With examples for how to express v.12

summary: Ensure that the "development release" of FHIR has a URL indicating that it's the development release
details:
E.g. don't host it at fhir.hl7.org/, but something like...

* fhir-dev.hl7.org

* fhir.hl7.org/dev
The Lipids example currently features it...

summary: On lipids, the profile source spreadsheet is correct, but the export that produces the profile.xml file is somehow losing the profile reference on Resource(Observation)
details: Also, in diagnosticreport-profile-lipids.profile.xml (that's a mouthful!) example... I still can't see where the DiagnosticReport structures called #LipidProfile ever references the Observation structures (#Cholesterol, #Triglyceride, #HDLCholesterol, and #LDLCholesterol).  Is this profile still broken?

summary: don't allow non-fixed bindings for elements of type "code".
details:
it seems like a clear error to have anything but "fixed" binding to a "code". (If you need incomplete bindings, you should be using "Coding" or "CodeableConcept" -- as the terminology binding docs imply: http://www.hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/terminologies.html#incomplete)

This principle is violated in at least eight places:

  Profile.structure.element.definition.type.code
  Profile.structure.type
  
  Conformance.rest.security.certificate.type
  Conformance.rest.resource.type
  Conformance.rest.resource.searchParam.target
  Conformance.messaging.event.focus
  
  DocumentReference.mimeType

summary: Profile.structure.element.definition.type elements should repeat to represent disjunction
details:
some Profile.structure.element.definition.type.code examples defining disjunctions like: 
Resource(Patient|Group|Device|Location)

while others define disjunctions like:
        <type><code value="Quantity"/></type>
        <type><code value="CodeableConcept"/></type>
        (etc.)
... are these equivalent?

summary: Make it clear that the Narrative for grouping constructs shouldn't include the narrative for the things grouped
details: documents.html says this about documents; but presumably it's true for standalone compositions; for Lists; and or DisgnosticReports.

[6:30:28 PM] David Hay: Just looking at compartments. The spec (2.1.11) has 2 formats:
[6:30:36 PM] David Hay: GET [base]/[compartment]/[id]/?[parameters]  {&_format=[mime-type]}
  GET [base]/[compartment]/[id]/[type]?[parameters]  {&_format=[mime-type]}
[6:31:30 PM] David Hay: Does the first format (GET [base]/[compartment]/[id]/?[parameters]  {&_format=[mime-type]}) mean that the server should return the most recent version of all known resources on that server?
[6:33:14 PM] David Hay: e.g. GET [base]/patient/100
[7:19:24 PM] Richard Schneider: My understanding is yes, it should return the most recent resource.
[8:53:36 PM] jcmandel: David: I don't think so. Given the mapping to "Patiient," I'd expect fetching [base]/Patient/100 returns the Patient resource
[8:53:50 PM] jcmandel: while fetching [base]/Patient/100/Observation returns a feed of observations about the patient
[8:54:09 PM] jcmandel: But whatever it is, it's not documented clearly.
[9:12:25 PM] David Hay: Aargh - you're correct of course!
[9:13:02 PM] David Hay: We should make a note in the spec as you say...
[9:16:53 PM] jcmandel: Yes -- and it's less clear how a compartment not centered around a resource like Patient would work...

<length value="[integer]"/><!-- 0..1 Length in seconds (audio / video) § -->

Avoid confusion with "width" by giving this field a clearer name.

summary: Bad link in XML example for Attachment
details: The link under "Mime type of the content, with charset etc." results in a 404.

summary: NullFlavor appears in some resource descriptions
details: We should avoid all reference to v3 concepts unless as part of a RIM or RMIM mapping
The text: "Equally, sometimes the person can be identified ('my aunt Agatha') and sometimes all that is known is that the person was an uncle." is duplicated.

summary: On lower resolutions, the menu shrinks to just a dropdown, but this dropdown is empty
details: Bootstrap offers this functionality, but obviously, we are using it incorrectly

summary: The tag operations for deleting tags use DELETE with a body. This is unsupported on some major platforms.
details: The HTTP spec is not clear on whether this is allowed, but fiddler marks it as illegal, it triggers a bug in .NET's WebApi and apache http library doesn't support sending it. Furthermore, the URL for the DELETE must indicate a resource endpoint, not an operation (the HTTP spec is clear on that).

summary: Allow Profiles to express relationships between profiles
details:
E.g. it would be good to express "supercedes".

 

Source: This item was brought up during the San Antonio CGIT meeting

summary: Need Profile to support both deltas and "compiled" expressions
details: At present, the resource presumes that it expresses the "compiled" form (though Ewout's tool just captures the 'difference' form).  There are use-cases for having each and in some cases, both.  We need to figure out whether that's two resources or one (and if two, how to link them).  If one, we need a way to distinguish which we're looking at.

Zip is USA centric. People in the USA can handle something called postalCode easier than people in other countries can handle zip, where it is often confused with the compression format. This comes from personal experience as a US citizen who spent years as an expat in Japan.

summary: Allow metadata to be easily expressed in XML for those without direct access to a FHIR server
details:
I would like to see metadata such as the profile id (tag, whatever) accessible to those who process resources using nothing other than the XML. Example

A developer wants to use Observation.xsd for consuming/building resources using off the shelf tools. They need (for their own devious purposes like validation, etc.) to know/express what profile(s) that resource conforms too. Right now they can't do that without an extension because the resource level schemas don't call in the elements from the atom namespace. Or, they need to use the full fhir.atom schema, which supposedly is not necessary for creating/consuming resources.

summary: Ensure that spreadsheets and profiles define all relevant named queries
details:
Currently named queries are documented only in "notes":

    fhir/build/source$ grep -ril "_query" **/*.xml
    conceptmap/conceptmap-notes.xml
    documentreference/documentreference-notes.xml
    valueset/valueset-notes.xml

 

These need to be documented in Profile.query (and, as a precursor, in the various -spreadsheet.xml files).

summary: Supply example XML is essentially empty
details:
The example XML for the Supply Resource has the following contents:

<!-- insert contents here -->

Could someone supply a real example, please?
The text wraps around the "Key concepts" image rather than starting on a new line.

summary: Value set ID misidentified in header
details: The ID is correctly identified in the text as http://hl7.org/fhir/vs/object-role, but is given in the header as http://hl7.org/fhir/object-role.

summary: "MIME type" deprecated in favor of "Media Type"
details: It seems that IANA is no longer using the term MIME Types, in favor of the new term Media Types. See for example http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml.Should DocumentReference.mimeType and the corresponding code set name be changed to reflect the current standard?  Also, would it make sense to point to the IANA page instead of BCP 13? I note that we also use the term Media Type (for example in Media.type, naturally enough).

summary: Conformance.software.releaseDate should be a date, not a dateTime
details: There's no case that I can think of for having a release date specified to the minute.

Condition usage[x] doesn't allow date, but one of the use cases it is intended to cover is this:

4:15 pm  onset of symptoms of acute MI

4:42 pm EMS arrives, vital signs, EKG

4:57 pm  arrival at ED, vital signs, EKG, laboratory test, administration of fibrinolytics

5:13 pm procedure begun in catheterization lab

Proposal: allow time portion

summary: Be specific that non-safe/non-idempotent methods SHOULD not use GET
details: Be specific that search implementations should use GET not POST if there is side effects or resources changes other than audit/accounting on the server, and add reference to Idempotency definitions. Also, add this note in the other section 2.2 (and fix up section numbering on this page too)

summary: xpath version of invariant for XHTML4 does not include img tag
details: Inv-1 lists the tags that are allowed in a div. The textual description of the invariant correctly states that images are allowed, but the img tag is not included in the xpath statement of the invariant. xpath-based validators would therefore reject valid div elements unless the tag is added.

summary: Document use of _id as search term on a binary resource
details: The spec says: "there is no support for the search interaction" - but there are corner cases for using the _id parmeter, and so this should be mentioned and allowed. ? is there use for a size parameter too? and a mime type search?

The 1st and 2nd paragraphs are repetitive and slightly contradict each other.

This specification assumes that content will be delivered from one application to another by some delivery mechanism, and then a response will be returned to the source application

vs.

This specification assumes that content will be delivered from one application to another by some delivery mechanism, and then one or more responses will be returned to the source application.

The example shown for references within contained resources uses the "Document" resource type which was a resource type that was superceded by "Composition" in the DSTU release.

The examples need to be replace by correct ones.

summary: Put link in standard parameter verbiage
details:
"The standard parameters also apply" should have "standard parameters" as a link to the "standard parameters" section in Query.

As well, the "standard parameters" section seems to talk about a bunch of stuff other than standard parameters and doesn't seem to expose the paging parameters, just _id (which we already list on each resource tab).
There's two "2.2" sections and no "2.1" section

summary: Need to differentiate Observation and Condition
details: The introductions for Observation and Condition need to clearly differentiate when one should be used and when the other should be used.

summary: Encounter-priority valueset has wrong (and duplicated) name and code system uri.
details:
The valueset resource for encounter-priority contains the following:

<identifier value="http://hl7.org/fhir/vs/encounter-priority" />

<name value="Diet" /> <!-- INCORRECT: should be "Priority" -->

<define>

<system value="http://hl7.org/fhir/diet" />  <!-- INCORRECT: should be "http://hl7.org/fhir/encounter-priority" -->

I think these were incorrectly copy-pasted from the encounter-diet valueset.
The identifier element of the Location resource defines its cardinality as 0..1.  It should be 0..* like it is for most other resources.

summary: Add Supply as a type of activity under CarePlan
details: Suppoy is supported in the Simple representation, but isn't one of the allowed resources under CarePlan.activity.detail.

The Immunization.identifier element appears to be defined as "A unique identifier assigned to this adverse reaction record". Should this definition be updated to reflect it is a unique identifier assigned to this immunization (not adverse reaction)?

Can the DocumentReference.description be renamed to DocumentReference.title for consistency with Composition.title?
* Composition.title is defined as "Official human-readable label for the composition"
* DocumentReference.description is defined as "Human-readable description of the source document. This is sometimes known as the title."

The HTML you describe at http://hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/observation-example-f201-bmi.html only displays the narrative. It does not decode any codes!!!

Yes, there is a BMI encoded correctly with 60621009 from SNOMED and 39165-5 from LOINC. 
BUT, there is an Observation immediately above that for weight, with the same SNOMED code 60621009 but a display value of "Weight". The SNOMED code is incorrect!

The fact that you can't see the error when you glance quickly at the XML proves my point!!

Yes, I have found other errors in the samples.
There are several errors in the sample NZ discharge summary document-example-dischargesummary(father).xml, including an invented UCUM code 'tbl'. I also recall in another sample, a code 'g/cm-2' also claiming to be a UCUM code.
there are also the LOINC mismatch errors (molar concentration instead of mass concentration)

summary: Tags, Bundles, Compartments and Binary Resources needs an Examples tab
details: All of the Resource pages have XML & JSON examples. Section 1.12.2.0 would benefit from some, so that implementers can make sure that they can parse these things correctly. There are some Bundle XML examples on the site, but they're in other sections (e.g. document-example-dischargesummary.xml) and not easy to find.

summary: Minor error in taglist XML definition
details:
The category element of a taglist should either be an empty tag (which I'd guess is the intention) or show what the content of the element is supposed to be. Current it shows an open tag with no content:

  <category term="[Tag URI]" label="[Tag Label]" scheme="http://hl7.org/fhir/tag">

The only place on the Web site that taglist is mentioned is in section 2.1.16. Although the XML definition is probably sufficient to figure out what's supposed to be in one, an example or two in XML and JSON would be helpful to implementers as input to unit tests, particularly since it's one of only three content types returned by servers (Resource and Bundle being the other two).

summary: Explain tags in relation to Web Categories better
details:
Explain that a FHIR TAG = RFC Category with scheme starting with "http://hl7.org/fhir/tag"

Since we have two paragraphs about Tags:

http://www.hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/http.html#tags

http://www.hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/extras.html

It's not clear at 2.1.16 that the "scheme" of the Category as actually relevant to indicate that a category header contains FHIR tags.

summary: Add link to improve documentations on isModifier
details:
The section to alter is http://hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/conformance-rules.html#isModifier

perhaps being a bit more explicit about the use of is-modifier in core elements and in extensions. The current wording is good for core elements but not extensions.

Perhaps a paragraph about the use in extensions that states that the 'isModifier' flag is set in the profile where the extension is defined, and that a resource that contains that extension must use the 'modifierExtension' element name. Then, an example of a modifierExtension in a resource and an explicit link to "http://hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/extensibility.html#modifierExtension"

Add text like this to make it more obvious what the intended se of must-support is:

- as an application designer, id set it to true to indicate that I couldn't exchange data with a system unless it supported a particular data

- as a purchaser, I would set it to true in my profile I want systems to conform to

- as a government project, I could publish my expectations as a formal standard

4.6.5 Resource Procedure - Formal Definitions / Procedure.date

Original text:

Definition    The dates over which the procedure was performed. Allows a period to support complex
procedures that span more *that* one date, and also allows for the length of the procedure
to be captured.

"That" in BOLD needs to be replaced with "than".
We currently have links for Java, C# and Pascal.
This is a place-holder to track all commits related to new resources that are part of the potential scope for the second DSTU release

summary: valueset name-part-qualifier references wrong system uri
details:
The valueset http://hl7.org/fhir/vs/name-part-qualifier uses ValueSet.compose.include to include codes from the "http://hl7.org/fhir/v3/EntityNamePartQualifier2" code system.

However, the system uri has a typo. It should be "http://hl7.org/fhir/v3/EntityNamePartQualifierR2" (note the added "R").

summary: It's not possible to order a procedure
details:
It's not possible to order a procedure. From the order documentation:

Note that a resource may only be used for the order details if the definition for the resource used in the detail explicitly defines how it is known to be something requested, as opposed to (for instance) something that has happened. 

procedure does not have such a definition, so procedures can't be ordered.

summary: 1.14.2.1.118.1  ObservationReliability VS  Consider adding concept of "Presumptive" for micro
details: In C & S results I see a lot of "presumptive" findings such as "Presumptive Organism X"  from microbiology Culture results.  The Laboratorian reports this out to the provider so they can act on this fuzzy knowledge while the sample may be sent to a reference lab for further testing. Sometimes this is as good as it gets.  (not to be confused when Presumptive is also used in another context  for political reasons usually for hot bugs like BSE and H5  when screen comes up positive the terms "presumptive" are prescribed and should be part of the result value vocabulary)

summary: 1.14.2.1.119.1  Observation Reference Range Meaning Codes publishing issue.
details: "..." before many codes is confusing and took me while to figure out the grouping.  Redo the table with subheadings and lose the "..."

summary: 1.13.3.5 Mappings for HL7 v2  Identifier.use  does not map to CX.5(Identifier Type Code)
details:
Identifier.use  does not map to CX.5(Identifier Type Code) 

Identifier.label  is a maps to CX.5(Identifier Type Code)

 

example:  From PID

PID.3[1] Patient Identifier List 
PID.3[1].1 ID Number: 18547545
PID.3[1].4 Assigning Authority 
...
PID.3[1].5 Identifier Type Code: MR

Mapped to....

ELR_1_1_1.identifier[0].use="usual";
ELR_1_1_1.identifier[0].label="MR";
ELR_1_1_1.identifier[0].system="urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.3.72.5.30.2";
ELR_1_1_1.identifier[0].value="18547545";

summary: 4.15.6  Resource Observation - Examples need to show related propert in use for panel and calculated measurement
details:
4.15.6  Resource Observation - Examples need to show related property in use for panel and calculated measurement

 

Currently none do.

This item is based on extensive discussion on the FHIR email list ("Heather Leslie's comment on allergy intolerance", February 2014), and discussion in disqus on the page (referenced above).

Issues:
* the value set for criticality is subjective, not objective

* The clinical issues associated with the use of this field (which is commonly used) should be documented

* the field is a candidate for moving out of the 80% into a documented extension

* there is a related field that could be added as well or instead of the element, a contraindication field (values: "true", "false", "unknown", and maybe "maybe") - need to assess whether this is 80% or a documented extension
Need additional guidace on how this element is to be used (e.g. capturing constraints on what pre-conditions might exist for the activity, whether it's required or optional, etc.)
Remove the extra space in "mappin g"

summary: Odd symbols at end of short descriptions
details: "§" is appearing at the end of several short descriptions

summary: Is there a reason to limit the subject of Questionnaire?
details: I expect there will be questionnaires about devices, medications, organizations, practioners and possibly quite a few other things.  I could understand just Patient, but if you're going to add RelatedPerson, why not other things?

summary: Need missed + rescheduled state added to Encounter.status
details:
The Encounter status is defined as planned | in progress | onleave | finished | cancelled.

The Virtual Medical Record for Clinical Decision Support (vMR-CDS) defines a MissedAppointment an appointment that was (i) scheduled, (ii) not rescheduled or canceled, and (iii) for which the EvaluatedPerson did not show up.

 

To be able to represent a MissedAppointment need to add "missed" to the encounter value list. Likewise, if an encounter was rescheduled also want to add a "rescheduled" state. In the rescheduled case, the Encounter.partOf field could reference the new scheduled encounter.

Table in Control of extensions defines interim repository search with URL: http://hl7connect.healthintersections.com.au/svc/fhir/profile/search

Submit entry has URL: http://hl7connect.healthintersections.com.au/svc/fhir/profile/upload

Clicking either URL reports an error. Document /svc/fhir/profile/search not found

base URL with links: http://www.hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/extensibility.html#definition

URLs need to be updated or removed until search/submit mechanism is working.

None of the statuses in the MedicationPrescription.status attribute deal with an order that is not yet active.  There are frequently use-cases for storing and passing around orders that have not yet been activated (works in progress, orders written by a med studant that need sign-off, orders for narcotics which may need counter-signing, draft orders that are being run through decision support before being activated, etc.

Suggest defining a new status called "draft".

Spec has an example showing:

<link href="[base]/Patient/34/history/31" rel="predecessor-version"/>

Should be:

<link href="[base]/Patient/34/_history/31" rel="predecessor-version"/>

Users of the Java implementation currently go to the official downloads section to download the source which is packaged up in a zip called java.zip.

As a user of this source code it is not clear which version of the java implementation (0.12,0.80 etc..?) is in that java.zip.

SOME (but not all) of the source code files contain a comment like this 

// Generated on Tue, Feb 25, 2014 16:54+1100 for FHIR v0.80 

But it isn't obvious to spot.

 

I request one of the following is done

1) Rename java.zip to java-version.zip (e.g. java-0.8.zip)

2) Include a README or CHANGELOG in the source folder containing the release number.


I also request that the downloads page includes a link to older releases in case the developer depends on code that has dependencies on an older release.

summary: HTTP delete interaction returns 204 on success but can include an OperationOutcome
details:
http://latest.fhir.me/http.html#delete

From https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2616#section-10.2.5: 'The 204 response MUST NOT include a message-body'

A successful delete should return a 200 response if it sends an OperationOutcome.

summary: if there is any relative links
details: Should be "if there are any relative links"
Shouldn't be an apostrophe in "it's".  Suggest doing a global search for it's.  We shouldn't be contracting anyhow

The description of how the "token" parameter type works uses the word [namespace], when the property in all 3 data types searched by "token" (Coding, CodeableConcept and Identifier) is "system".  As well, while Coding and CodeableConcept use "code", Identifier uses "value", so to be explicit, the documentation should reflect both terms.  So we'd have:

[code/value]

[system]|[code/value]

|[code/value]

as the three possible usages

At present, the section is silent on whether multiple modifiers can be combined.  Most combinations make no sense, but :text and :exact together do make sense and could be useful.  Need to declare whether that's allowed or not, and if so, whether the modifiers need to come in a specific order.

At the moment, modifiers are prohibited on combination query paramters (e.g. name-value).  However, there are definitely use-cases where modifiers would be useful - :text, :exact, :missing, etc. are all potentially useful.  While there are edge cases where modifiers could apply to either of the arguments, in the places where we have combination parameters now, the biggest benefit would be having them apply to the second parameter.  So rather than prohibiting modifiers on combination parameters, I'd advocate for allowing them and simply declaring that they apply to the last parameter and must be appropriate for the type of the last parameter.

summary: Need to clarify how tag searches work on Document end point
details: The _tag search parameter could apply to tags on the atom feed or on the initial Composition resource or both.  My recommendation would be both, but in any event, the spec needs to make this clear.

summary: Clarify whether servers must support both GET & POST queries
details: We indicate there are two methods, but don't indicate whether servers need to support both.  Recommendation is that they must.  (If not, then we need to add ability for Conformance to indicate whether system supports GET, POST or both.

Conformance.rest.resource.searchParam.definition

This SHALL be populated for all search parameters not defined as part of the core FHIR specification. The uri is the uri of the profile defining the parameter followed by "#" followed by the structure name and search parameter name.
 

---

*should say* 

"the parameter followed by "#" followed by the structure name followed by "." followed by the search parameter name."

(Or preferably something equivalent but less verbose. And also should include an example.)

Every instance is wrong. For example:

Wrong:

      <searchParam>
        <name value="substance"/>
        <definition value="http://hl7.org/fhir/profiles/AdverseReaction"/>

 

Should be:

      <searchParam>
        <name value="substance"/>
        <definition value="http://hl7.org/fhir/profiles/AdverseReaction#AdverseReaction.substance"/>

1. "There should be a representation in the narrative for each item in the list, and vice versa,"

I don't understand what this means.

 

2. "This means that the narrative content of the list will be limited to the version of the contained resources"

clarify that this is not in fact referring to what FHIR usually means by "contained resources" (that is, it's not about <contained>, bur rather simply about "items in the list"?)

In the .NET package library I'm looking at: https://github.com/ewoutkramer/fhir-net-api/blob/master/src/Hl7.Fhir.Model/Model/ModelInfo.cs

This is a nice set of data to have. And there's nothing like it in the Java reference implementation. I think I might just stop-gap by packaging up all the *.profile.xml files into a "profiles" dir in the Maven package, so at least folks using a given version of the Java-RI will have access to these details. (My practical reason: I need xpath definitions of search params to come from somewhere.)
[12:08:18 PM] Grahame Grieve: We can add that. Make a gforge task ;-)
The links to the various historical versions don't resolve.  Also, the link "through the HL7 gForge archives." directs to the wiki

summary: *.profile.xml files in the FHIR spec are missingProfile.structure.name ?
details:
*.profile.xml files in the FHIR spec are missing the property http://hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/profile-definitions.html#Profile.structure.name

 

This is theoretically optional, but it's required to resolve searchParam.definition URIs in Conformance.
Having a body weight with no identified patient isn't that useful

summary: Observation name-value composite parameter not necessary
details: Now that Observation doesn't have components any more, there's no need for name-value composite on Observation.

summary: Examples of tags in an HTTP header
details: Feedback from the FHIR hands-on course: It would be userful to have an example of an HTTP header with a couple of tags specified rather than just having the grammar defined.  (We have atom examples showing tags, but nothing showing tags for an HTTP request)

summary: Reference to use of cids is misleading in references page
details:
Note that internal references are allowed to be URIs rather than literal URLs. A typical case is the use of cid: URIs in a transaction.

However, in a transaction, these would not be "internal" references, they'd be references between resources.  They wouldn't really qualify as either absolute or relative.  They're temporary ids.  The documentation on the use of cids needs to be clarified and improved.  (Including whether cids are allowed to be used within documents or messages - they're a lot more friendly than urn:oid:.........
Should be /svc/Profile/c8973a22-2b5b-4e76-9c66-00639c99e61b

summary: CarePlan Example seems out of date
details:
The CarePlan example here seems to be out of date:

http://latest.fhir.me/careplan-example-integrated.xml.html

In the <activity> tag, an extension is used to convey the link to the goal it applies to, but there is a <goal> element which seems suited for that purpose. Presumably the <goal> element didn't exist when the example was created so an extension was used to convey that piece of information.

summary: Extensibility TOC shows isModifier rather than "Modifier Extensions"
details: We updated the heading, but not the TOC entry

Questionnaire.group.name says that it's a structured name that identifies the question within the questionnaire or group.  However, its data type is a CodeableConcept.

There are two requirements.  One is a label that serves as a unique identifier.  E.g. "Question 1" or "II.b3".  These only have meaning/relevance within the context of a single questionnaire.  The second is a need to identify the a question in a questionnaire as being "the same" as a standardized question defined in some ontology (a list of CDEs, a code system like LOINC, etc.) and/or as a question that might appear in other questionnaires or even other locations within the same questionnaire.  For this, "CodeableConcept" is an appropriate data type.

I think we need to split "name" into these two distinct concepts.  The second one might be a candidate to bump to an extension.  In either case, we should probably look at the name "name" and verify it's going to make sense to domain experts.  (Because at first blush, I thought it was equivalent to Observation.name and Procedure.name . . .

summary: MedicationPrescription.quantity definition needs to be clarified
details: Needs to make clear that it's the amount to dispense at one time, not the total amount authorized (which would be quantity * numberOfRepeatsAllowed)

summary: Simplification of Schemas #1 - circular references in xhtml1-strict.xsd
details: The schema's are FHIR. Everything else is an artifact based on the schemas. As a true "open" specification, any developer should be able to use a modern toolset to generate classes based on the schemas with no edits to the schemas or resulting classes. Any edits that need to be performed make an implementeation unique. To that end I am pointing out issue #1 - circular references in the xhtml1-strict.xsd schema. These circular references prevent the generation of classes using .net tools like xsd.exe and xsd2code. It appears, these references are also in support of HTML embedded in xml documents. In my opinion, this is not a good idea, because it breaks most xml parsers. I suggest dropping HTML embedded in XML as XML. If this is not acceptable, then editing the circular references out of xhtml1-strict.xsd is required.

summary: Simplification of Shcemas #2  - do not use  tag in xmldsig-core-schema.xsd
details: The schema's are FHIR. Everything else is an artifact based on the schemas. As a true "open" specification, any developer should be able to use a modern toolset to generate classes based on the schemas with no edits to the schemas or resulting classes. Any edits that need to be performed make an implementeation unique. To that end I am pointing out issue #2 - <any> tag in xmldsig-core-schema.xsd. The any tag results in the generation of XMLNode types in the resulting classes. Classes genereated with this type cannot be used in .Net portable class libraries. This prevents the use of fhir classes using Mono/C# for Android and iOS devices. In my classes, I have commented out the <any> tag to generate classes.

summary: Schema Simplification #3 - remove embedded HTML from schemas <div>
details: The schema's are FHIR. Everything else is an artifact based on the schemas. As a true "open" specification, any developer should be able to use a modern toolset to generate classes based on the schemas with no edits to the schemas or resulting classes. Any edits that need to be performed make an implementeation unique. To that end I am pointing out issue #3 - the use of the <div> tag appears to support HTML embedded in xml documents. In my opinion, this is not a good idea, because it breaks most xml parsers. I suggest dropping HTML embedded in XML as XML.

The schema's are FHIR. Everything else is an artifact based on the schemas. As a true "open" specification, any developer should be able to use a modern toolset to generate classes based on the schemas with no edits to the schemas or resulting classes. Any edits that need to be performed make an implementeation unique. To that end I am pointing out issue #4 - Attributes with the name "value". I have identified a number of locations that generate a "value" property. The complextype "boolean" is one. The class generated has a "value" property. Using native serialization "value" is not serialized, however "Value" is. This requires edits to the generated classes to ensure the correct xml will be generated:

public partial class boolean : Element
...
[System.Xml.Serialization.XmlAttributeAttribute("value")]
public bool Value
{

This failure to serialize behaviour is not consistent, but I suggest the use of the word "val" or "Value" to replace "value". By making this change a number of manual edits in classes can be removed.

summary: Change Patient.gender to a simple code
details:
Presently, Patient.gender is a CodeableConcept. I believe that this is a wrong assessment of complexity- yes, there are multiple coding systems for gender, and yes, a few institutions use an extended list of codes (i've even seen 17). However 99%+ of systems use Male, Female, Other, Unknown, and all the additional codes are finer grained variations of these. 

It would be a lot simpler to fix patient.gender to a simple code (M,F,O,U), and define an extension for the few systems that want to exchange a finer grained gender than that. This has the same functional outcome, but makes it much easier for implementers, who know that they'll get one of the 4 base codes at least.

summary: Message event list is a mess
details: The list seems semi random and highly arbitrary.  Surely there are more resources that have messaging events defined with just these?  (And the set that is defined for each resource doesn't necessarily seem to be complete.)  As well, once the list *does* get close to complete, publishing them all under Messaging seems odd.  It may make sense to have an integrated list linked from Messaging (and from the appropriate attribute under MessageHeader).  It would also make sense to have the events associated with each resource listed (or at least linked from) each of the individual resources.

"(e.g. for messages or documents, or exchanged in a service , the"

should be

"(e.g. for messages or documents, or exchanged in a service), the"
"re-identified (i.e. assigned a new resource)" should be "re-identified (i.e. assigned a new URL and possibly logical id)"

<link href="http://hl7connect.healthintersections.com.au/svc/fhir/Practitioner/example/history/1" rel="self"/>

should be

<link href="http://hl7connect.healthintersections.com.au/svc/fhir/Practitioner/example/_history/1" rel="self"/>

Would be nice if this could be validated by the tools

summary: Expose the code system URI in value set narrative
details: The auto-generated rendering for value sets should include the URI of the code system.  (Implementers need it, so it should be visible.)

More guidance on the use of the "planned" status for encounter is required - and particularly how it differs from appointments and appointment requsts.  My understanding of "planned" is an encounter record will get set up at an organization where an encounter is scheduled for tracking early data records such as consent, pre-admit tests, etc.  It is *not* intended for use in other systems to capture details of a desired encounter (e.g. as part of a care plan).  Further guidance is needed so implementers know when to use Encounter and when to use something else like Appointment or AppointmentRequest.

summary: CarePlan detail shouldn't reference Encounter or Procedure
details:
The CarePlan.activity.detail reference is intended to point to resources that describe planned activities and orders.  Encounter and Procedure both deal with events, not planning.  While Encounter has a "planned" status, this corresponds to moodCode=EVN, statusCode=new.  Essentially an encounter used to capture early data like pre-admit tests, consent, etc.  It is *not* used in situations where there's no expectation that the record will transition to an active encounter - e.g. when defining what sort of activity is desired to happen or when or where.

The use-cases that PC was intending to satisfy here should be met by referencing Referral and possibly AppointmentRequest.  Those will allow defining the characteristics of desired future encounters and procedures and are resources properly rooted in INT mood.

summary: Some resources use "patient," others use "subject" -- it's confusing and sometimes arbitrary
details:
e.g. MedicationAdministration has a "patient" but Immunization has a "subject".

 adverse reaction, conditoin, procedure

"subject" is the more general term, and if we feel like the generality is worthwhile in the majority of resources, we might as well just use it across the board. As-is, the distinction feels arbitrary and I commonly have trouble remembering which resources use which term.

summary: Add a search parameter "language" for all resource types
details: Add a search parameter "language" so that clients can search for resources of a particular language (this is particularly relevant for questionnaires)

summary: Outdated example for provenance entity references
details:
The party references example still refers to "person" and uses the older "@" notation for identifiers:

We should update this to Patient.

summary: Should describe links from narrative to content
details: FHIR supports linking between narrative and discrete content.  This is briefly touched on in the section on references (internal references), but it isn't discussed at all on the narrative page.  It should be addressed, ideally including guidance on when and why you might want to.

Could we change the description of the"id" data type to just "A combination of lowercase letters, numerals, "-" and ".", with a length limit of 36 characters regex: [a-z0-9\-\.]{1,36}"

With the current definition I wrongly assumed that an uuid ID would be "urn:uuid:...".

summary: Composite Search Param And/Or wording distinction
details:
Composite search params given an elegant way of allowing any combination of AND and OR terms using repeated keys and comma separation. It would be nice to see the language in this section expanded a bit to explicityly call out / define the concepts of AND queries and OR queries, so that implementations can point to these definitions.

A simple suggested enhancement follows.

----

The result of the search operation is the intersection of the resources that match the criteria specified by each individual search parameter. If a parameter repeats, such as /patient?language=FR&language=NL, then this matches a patient who speaks both languages. <new>This is known as an AND query parameter, since the server is expected to respond only with results which match both values. </new>

If, instead, the search is to find patients that speak either language, then this is a single parameter with multiple values, separated by a ',': <new> for example </new> "/patient?language=FR,NL". <new>This is known as an OR query parameter, since the server is expected to respond with results which match either value.

AND parameters and OR parameters may also be combined, for example: "/patient?language=FR,NL&language=EN" would refer to any patient who speaks English as well as either French or Dutch.</new>

summary: Conformance SearchParams should be more powerful
details:
The definition for parameter chaining is weak in the specification.

Per a discussion with Graham on the Skype chat, the current intended use is for chain to be used as the dot notation is often used for FHIR paths. E.g. if I can search by Observation.subject.identifier then I should see a search parameter like <searchParam><name="subject"/><chain value="identifier"/></searchParam>

This is weak IMO for several reasons:

1. The dot notation is used everywhere else. It should be allowable within a search param as well. Chaining as a substitute notation is just confusing.

2. I would prefer chaining to be used to specify allowable combinations of parameters. I.e. If i allow searching for an observation by aubject and name, I could do something like <searchParam><name="subject.identifier"/><chain value="name"/></searchParam>

The counter argument to #2 (offered by Grahame G) is that this leads to permutation explosion in the case of servers (such as his) that support a large number of query parameters and allow any possible combination of those params. My counter-counter argument to that is that this is an edge case, since well over 80% of real world systems have a very limited number of actual allowable search parameters that they can compute efficiently.

In addition, the status quo makes conformance profiles ambiguous since there is no way of spelling out which exact combinations of parameters are valid, only which combinations are theoreticallly possible. This type of ambiguity is desirable elsewhere in the spec, but should absolutely not be allowed in conformance.

A possible reolution to Grahame's objection would be some sort of "*" notation?

summary: Add extension for FamilyHistory.relation to point to Patient
details: Define an extension to allow relation to point to Patient (and perhaps note that extension in the description of relation)

Jcmandel: just noticed (while I was presenting FHIR on a phone call as a great approach to patient-reported outcomes) that Observation.performer isn't allowed to be a Patient. Is this intentional or an oversight?
[10:31:51 AM] Lloyd McKenzie: It's borderline 80%.  I could get convinced
[10:32:33 AM] jcmandel: Certainly would help present a compelling story about PROs.
[11:03:06 AM] Lloyd McKenzie: Want to submit a tracker? :)

EH: Same as #3259

The documentation for the searchParams element states "Additional search params defined".

Thsi should be something like "Search parameters supported by this server"

summary: Conformance and Profile need to be able to make Query declarations in the context of resources
details: Conformance's Query component is only used in "Rest", and not on "Resource" level... you'd like to indicate that you support certain _query=x operations for a specific resource type. It would be ok, if the Query referred to an actual definition in a Profile, and that definition would indicate on which Resource it should work. But on Profile, Query is also not connected to a specific Structure...
Add an identifier for list.item so that continuity in the logical list items can be tracked over time.

summary: Allow for simple text in the reference range of an observation
details: Currently there is no simple way to represent a text based reference range in an observation, but this is common in verison 2 so will be a requirement for many implementers.

summary: drop the requirement for _search as a search option
details:
Currently there are 2 ways to specify a search parameter:

GET [base]/[type]?[parameters] {&_format=[mime-type]}

GET [base]/[type]/_search?[parameters] {&_format=[mime-type]}

the _search option (for a GET) seems redundant...

Additional pages defined include FHIR methodology, use of the FHIR design tools, etc. - FHIR methodology link is now deleted.  Should point to http://wiki.hl7.org/index.php?title=FHIR_Guide_to_Designing_Resources
"However this cannot consistently be assured. and When"

The usual guidance in HL7 is to use a date.  It is comptable, it provides automated fall-back (use next earlier or later version available) and is determinable even for code systems that don't formally define versions.  Why aren't we providing that guidance here?  Or even enforcing it by constraining string to date?

summary: Questionnaire should provide a way to capture who designed the questionnaire
details:
[12:43:14 PM] jcmandel: Does Questionnare not have a way to record the "author" as in the person who designed the questionnaire? (As it stands, the "author" property appears limited to capturing the person who filled out a questionnaire instance.)
[12:46:20 PM] Grahame Grieve: if it's just a set of questions with no answers then the author is the one who designed the questionnaire
[12:47:20 PM] jcmandel: So the meaning of "author" is conditional on the value of "status"?
[12:47:56 PM] jcmandel: This 1) seems fishy, and 2) contradicts the definition in http://hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/questionnaire-definitions.html#Questionnaire.author
[12:51:56 PM] Grahame Grieve: agree.
[12:52:07 PM] jcmandel: I'll add a tracker issue.

This isn't required in v2 or v3, which means if we convert from either of those to FHIR (which will be the most common reason for using messaging at all), we end up populating it with a string that says something like "unknown".  That's not friendly or useful.  It's not a piece of information that's critical to interoperability.  In fact, it's even questionable whether it's within the 80%.  We can include language encouraging its use, but it should not be required.

In HumanName, Address and Identifier, the "use" property appears first - before all the other content of the data type.  With Contact, it appears towards the end.  There's no obvious reason for this inconsistency.
The short description for feed.author and feed.author.name refer to "resource".  They should refer to "bundle"

summary: Condition.relatedItem should be split into two properties
details:
<relatedItem> <!-- 0..* Causes or precedents for this Condition --> <type value="[code]"/><!-- 1..1 due-to | following --> <code><!-- 0..1 CodeableConcept Relationship target by means of a predefined code --></code> <target><!-- 0..1 Resource(Condition|Procedure|MedicationAdministration| Immunization|MedicationStatement) Relationship target resource --></target> </relatedItem>

 

Why not add a 

 

 "dueTo[x]": CodeableConcept | ResourceReference
 "occurredFollowing[x]": CodeableConcept | ResourceReference

Or forget about the [x] and just have dueTo: {code 0..1, target 0,,1}, and occurredFollowing (content as for dueTo).

summary: Being able to query by value set
details:
On Searching for all Conditions where a Condition.code.coding in X, where X is a value set

This is not in the spec. We did discuss it once before, but I don't remember where (or even with who other than Ewout). I think we settled on this:

/Condition?code:valueset={id}

where id is either a simple identifier of a local value set, or a full url of some other valueset. The server is obligated to expand the value set if it needs to (there are other ways to answer this query without expansion)

Let us make it so.

summary: DiagnosticOrder to allow linked supporting observations
details:
My system allows multiple supporting observertions on lab requests, and while I can sent Observation resources in the same message bundle, there seems no way to link these to the DiagnosticOrder.

There is clinicalNotes, but that's string only and 0..1
I could do with clinicalNotes: Resource(Observation) 0..*

Having said that, there is also a need for multipe supporting text items as clinicalNotes.

So I could really do with 

clinicalNotes: string|Resource(Observation) 0..*

I'm not sure if an attribute can be a combination of a string and a resource however.

I am mapping from V2 lab messages to FHIR, and requests can have multiple NTE segments and multiple OBXs.

While I can concatenate the NTEs into one string, that gets messy and the semantics muddled.
"withing questions in relevant" should be "within questions is relevant"

summary: Profiles shouldn't have to define extension.extension.extension...
details:
For example in the FamilyHistory profile

"path": "FamilyHistory.relation.extension.extension.extension",

This kind of things shouldn't appear. Defining FamilyHistory.relation.extension should be deep enough; since that definition "links to" the "relationParent" extension:

"type": [ { "code": "Extension", "profile": "#relationParent" } ],

...

then subsequent details should be described in the #relationParent extension, not repeated ad nauseum in the FamilyHistory.relation structure. 

This would:

1. Cut down dramatically on the size of the generated profile (and hence improve readability, since there would be far less line noise)

2. Resolve the question of "when to stop" (after all, why stop at extension.extension.extension? What about extension.extension.extension.extension.... ?)

As I understand V3, when using the nullFlavor of OTH, the coding system must be specfied to indicate that the value is other than what is available in the indicated coding system. In FHIR, you cannot do that because OTH comes from a coding system.  I don't think this is killer, because valueSet lets you specific the value set that restricts code, but it may be worth noting.

summary: Not all documents are about the specified subjects
details: A health quality measure document has as its subject perhaps a Condition or a Medication or a Procedure, or some other Resource.  Resource type should be Any and it may not be very specific or identifiable to an instance, only a kind.  Measures about Aspirin are not to a specific MedicationResource, for example, or those about Heart Attack are not specific to a single instance of Heart Attack.

summary: Why aren't author, attester and custodian not simply Provenance resources
details: Why aren't author, attester and custodian not simply referenced using the Provenance resource.  These seem to duplicate each other needlessly.  There are two ways to say author given the examples provided for Provenance.

summary: Need to explain difference between business & technical ids
details: We have attributes called "identifier" and "version" all over the place.  It's possible that some readers will encounter these resources without yet having read resoruces.html or other pages that explain the difference between business identifiers and versions and the technical server-specific ids.  We should include a common blurb and link on the description of all elements with the name "identifier" or "version" that covers this.

Form designs behave the same way as profiles and value sets in terms of version id.  In some environments, old form versions might be "maintainable".  As well, there's typically a business version that only changes when the form content itself changes, not when metadata (description, author, status, etc.) change.

For ValueSets that define own codes, the coding system URL must be globally unique. This is not indicated in the standard. This constraint should be marked as an invariant, as well as discussed in the text under section 6.13.6.

summary: Coding system for Encounter.priority is wrong
details: The coding system for ValueSet http://hl7.org/fhir/vs/encounter-priority, used in Encounter.priority, is defined in the value set (and documentation) as http://hl7.org/fhir/diet. It should be changed to a correct URL, presumably http://hl7.org/fhir/encounter-priority.

The definition of CarePlan.participant.role imposes no constraints at all on its value. Other participant role elements are all defined in terms of value sets that obtain their values from http://hl7.org/fhir/v3/RoleCode (e.g. RelatedPerson.relationship). A value set for this element (e.g. http://hl7.org/fhir/vs/carePlanParticipantRole) should be defined, including a sufficient broad set of role codes to accommodate most uses.

summary: Better explain how a slice's discriminator works
details:
I think we should expand the page on Profile to indicate that:

·         When the sliced element is *not* a ResourceReference: The discriminator indicates an element within the sliced element

·         When the sliced element is a ResourceReference: The discriminator indicates an element within the referenced resource.

However, as Josh noticed, we might also want to designate an extensions within the sliced element as the discriminator, even when the extended element is a ResourceReference. So for example a profile should be able to slice on the value of "performerType" in Observation data like:

 

"performer": {

  "extension": {

    url: "http://my-vocab/performerType",

    valueString: "assistant performer"

  }

  "reference": "/Practitioner/123"

}

summary: Observation should allow DateTime as an allowed type for the value
details: Some observations are a simple date/time, such as Loinc 11778-8 Delivery date Estimated. Observation needs to allow a date time for this
Suggest renaming Group.header to Group.title

summary: FHIR needs a build status page
details: ... ideally with a continuous integration server that builds after every commit.

summary: example of extensions has old format
details: examples of extensions are in the older format.

it would be useful if Profile.structure.element.definition.type.profile could repeat - to indicate that the content must conform to multiple profiles (and, not or - you'd do or by having multiple types to choose from)
The profile generator never populates the Profile.structure.element.definition.condition field, though it has the information available to it

summary: Profile.discriminator is a problem for heterogenous lists
details: Current profile rules require that slicing always must nominate a discriminator. That's to serve automatic code generation associated with using profiles. But it doesn't always make sense to nominate a discriminator - in heterogenous lists (collections of disparate information), it might not be possible to nominate one. Sure, that means you couldn't have the processing short cut that it represents, but that's not reason to prohibit describing those types of profiles. So it should be made optional

summary: Improvements to profile documentation around slicing
details:
There are multiple opportunities for improving the documentation around slicing:

- what happens if the slice is open - are dicriminators allowed to overlap? 

- make it clear about how slicing works with regard to constraints on sub-propeties (clearer example)

The cardinality of ValueSet.expansion.contains.system is defined as [0..1]. I'm having trouble seeing a valid use for it being optional. The contains element must come from one of the following (according to 6.13.8):

* An in-line coding system, enumerated in the define element, in which case the system element is mandatory.

* An include, where, again, the system is mandatory

* Another value set, via an import element, in which case the above two cases apply.

In no case is it possible to place a code into an expansion without knowing, at that point, the coding system to which it belongs. Making it mandatory seems obvious to me, and making it optional seems to place an unnecessary burden on the recipient of the expansion, in having to figure out what the coding system ought to have been. That, in turn, is needed because there is potentially information about the code that is known by the coding system, but not the value set (e.g. in the case of an import, where you'd have to look at the referenced value set to get its in-lined coding system to find out if a code is abstract or not).

summary: Clarify rules for missing system in ValueSet
details: The ValueSet resource expansion.contains.system to be omitted but doesn't explain when this should occur.  Documentation should be enhanced to reflect that this is for abstract codes.

The property whenGiven in MedicationAdmistration is misleading when wasNotGiven is set to true. Description also adds to confusion and requires an update as it doesn't cover the wasNotGiven scenario. Currently it states, "An interval of time during which the administration took place."

If wasNotGiven is true, the current whenGiven would actually be used to define the time period during which the medication was NOT given. Field name should preferably be renamed.

summary: Add reference for handling epub documents under Linux
details: http://askubuntu.com/questions/14378/what-software-can-i-use-to-view-epub-documents does a good job of discussing the options for viewing epub documents under Linux (for the list of suggestions after the "FHIR Book" entry).

summary: Add "twin" back to family history parent relationships value set
details: The value set was incorrectly specified, causing it to resolve to an empty set.  Prior to publication, the value set was corrected to remove the reference to TWIN.  What should have happened was a restructuring of the value set to include both parent and twin relationships.

summary: Need to clarify what's normative and what's not
details: The specification currently doesn't make clear whether the reference implementations are considered to be "part" of the specification from a conformance perspective.  Same issue arises from examples.  Suggest adding language in conformance.html that indicates that reference implementations are outside the specification and that examples are considered informative.  Should also add a short blurb in the header for each example page as well on downloads.html that re-enforces this.

summary: JSON Examples should have a "raw" link like XML
details:
JSON exmples like:
http://hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/adversereaction-example.json.html

 

Should have a "raw" link the same way as XML examples like:

http://hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/adversereaction-example.xml.html

 

Furthermore, the raw JSON payloads like:http://hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/adversereaction-example.json should be pretty-printed. They're examples, after all -- they should be readable.

summary: Example still mentions a Document resource
details: The example for a contained resource, shows a parent "Document" resource, containing an "Organization". There's no Document resource anymore. As well, the introductory text above talks about a Condition and a Practitioner, so it would make sense to use this as an example.

summary: Question component of Questionnaire needs extensions to express cardinality
details: When a question allows multiple answers, it should be possible to contstrain the number of allowed answers.

summary: Question component of Questionnaire should allow multiple answers
details: To allow for multiple answers to a question, we should find a construct that allows multiple answer[x] values. At the same time, this might mean we need multiple data[x] as well. Since we cannot make answer[x] repeat, introduce a new component?  Use an "additionalAnswer" extension as per the may Connectathon?

When using XML, the name is "taglist". When using JSON, the name is "TagList"

This is a way to trip people up, and the XML name should be "TagList"

summary: Should differentiate between text and textarea answer formats
details: It would be useful to know whether questionnaire data should be captured as a simple text string (single line text box) vs. a multi-line narrative (multi-line text area).  Propose adding "text" as an additional value. to the http://hl7.org/fhir/answer-format vallue set

summary: Parent concept in medication-form-codes and medication-package-form-codes is wrong
details: The parent concept in both http://hl7.org/fhir/vs/medication-form-codes and http://hl7.org/fhir/vs/medication-package-form-codes is listed as 284009009 (Route of adminstration value). This parent is also (correctly) listed for http://hl7.org/fhir/vs/route-codes, which appears to be the value set from which the other two were erroneously copied.

summary: profile refers to 'isModifier' in the instance
details:
In section 6.14.2.1 of http://www.hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/profile.html it the statement:

The consequence of this is that if a profile mandates behavior that cannot be ignored, it must also mandate an extension with isModifier=true in the instance. Another way of saying this is that knowledge must be explicit in the instance, not implicit in the profile.

should be something like:

The consequence of this is that if a profile mandates behavior that cannot be ignored, it must be represented in the instance in the instance using a <modifierExtension>. Another way of saying this is that knowledge must be explicit in the instance, not implicit in the profile.

summary: modify the 'valueset' search parameter in profile
details:
The definition for the valueset search parameter is Profile.structure.element.definition.binding.reference[x] 

As valuesets can also be in extesnions, then it should include Profile.extensionDefn.definition.binding.reference[x]
Would be useful if the conformance resource could indicate compartments supported by a server

summary: Duplicate value set identifiers for v3/Confidentiality
details: The value set http://hl7.org/fhir/v3/vs/Confidentiality occurs twice in file v3-codesystems.xml, which is part of the "All value sets" download on the download page (2.5). The first occurrence has a define, which defines coding system http://hl7.org/fhir/v3/Confidentiality. The second, which includes a version element, has no define, but includes a compose with an include element pointing to http://hl7.org/fhir/v3/Confidentiality.

summary: Profile ids in example URLs should be versioned
details:
We have expressed policy that when profiles are updated and contain breaking changes, their RESTful identifiers should change as well (since old instances might otherwise refer to profiles they do no longer conform to). In our examples, whenever we refer to profile, we use RESTful identifiers that do not have a version indication. To support this policy, we should probably change the examples to do so.

E.g. change http://hl7.org/fhir/Profiles/iso-21090 to http://hl7.org/fhir/Profiles/iso-21090-2011

summary: Case is wrong on resource type in patient compartment search examples
details:
GET [baseurl]/Patient/[id]/condition


elsewhere, there's this:


  GET [base-url]/Patient/23/procedure?date=>2010-01-01&date=<2011-12-31


but both should be uppercased

"Note that each page of the FHIR specification contains a direct link to its matching wiki page where input from the wider community is managed. Community input is very welcome - please consider making comments" - not true anymore

summary: Profile needs an invariant on ElementDefn to make sure min < max
details: ElementDefn has a min and max, but there's no invariant making sure what min<max (this is complicated a bit because max may be ''*' to express unlimited, but still....)

summary: Rename element 'dateTime' to 'created' in Media resource
details:
Suggest renaming the element 'dateTime' to 'created' in Media resource to provide clarity and name consistence with the similar element in DocumentReference.

Also the descriptions could be expanded for more clarity.

summary: Profile invariant 4 Conformance should be lowercase
details: In the xpath

The text says this "should" be a timestamp.  But that makes no sense.  The whole point of having a version is to convey a business version - something that might not change with every update.  The guidance advocating timestamp should be dropped.

summary: Wrong guidance for Profile code search criteria
details: The guidance for the "code" search criteria is that it should be "in the format uri::code".  That's not the syntax we landed on for codes as tokens.  The guidance should be dropped as the rules for handling codes are covered in the description of the "token" search parameter type.

summary: Questionnaire author should be able to be an organization
details: When questionnaire is used to represent forms, it usually makes more sense to capture the organization that created than than it does a particular patient

summary: Glitches in US state drivers' license coding systems
details:
- Indiana is missing from the list of US State drivers' licenses. (urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.4.3.18?)

- Two-word state names in the XML (valuesets.xml) are missing spaces ("NewYork Driver&#39s License", "NorthCarolina Driver's License"...).

summary: "The id of this profile is" should only show for profiles with an id
details: Tooling issue.  Just add a check whether an id is defined before including the paragraph.

The value set ProvenanceEntityType is not present in the download of value sets (valuesets.xml). The text describing indicates that it includes http://hl7.org/fhir/resource-types, and the hypertext link goes directly to resource-types.html, but the value set itself is not present in the distribution. A value set with:

<identifier value="http://hl7.org/fhir/vs/participant-entity-type"/>
<compose>
  <include>
    <system value="http://hl7.org/fhir/resource-types"/>
  </include>
</compose>

should be constructed and included in valuesets.xml.

Coding system http://hl7.org/fhir/restful-operation is referenced from several value sets, including security-event-sub-type, system-restful-operation and type-restful-operation, but it is not defined anywhere. In each of the places it is used, specific codes are included from it.

summary: profiles-resources are missing ElementDefn.condition nodes pointing to the Constraint.id
details: Although the profiles-resources.xml do contain the invariants, the elements involved in the invariants should have their ElementDefn.condition field set.

summary: Clarify how to specify an Extension's context if this is a resource element with a choice type
details: Need to clarify that the context is value[x] if the extension works on all choice types, or otherwise an (enumeration of) explicit valueType elements if not.

summary: Slices should have a ElementDefn too
details:
Currently, we have an invariant that says:

Inv-11: On Profile.structure.element: Must have either a slice or a definition, but not both (xpath on f:Profile/f:structure/f:element: exists(f:slicing) != exists(f:definition))

But this prohibits the slice to 

* constrain/refine the meaning of the sliced element by changing the definition text

* Give a maximum/minimum cardinality across all slices (useful for open slices)

It is not clear to me whether this means there should also be a TypeRef, since this may clash with TypeRefs in the individual slices, although you could in open slices in theory constrain a choice of type once we had value[x] 0..* (but we don't)

summary: Description of binding strength and extensibility needs clarification
details:
There are three sets of terminology used to dictate what codes may be used as part of value sets in Resources. The first is binding conformance, defined in 1.14.2.1.144.1 to include "required", "preferred" and "example". The second set is extensibility, including extensible and non-extensible. The final set is the cross product of the first two. Of the six combinations, three are referenced in the core specification by special names. These are:

"fixed" meaning (required, non-extensible)
"incomplete" meaning (preferred, extensible)
"example" meaning (example, extensible)

These terms are used in the documentation without sufficient detail for a person doesn't already understand them to be able to understand what they mean. Explicitly labelling these sets of terminology, and defining the labels, would go a long way to helping them be more easily understood.

summary: Don't say that "=" needs to be "escaped" in search parameters
details:
http://www.hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/search.html#number is incorrect. It says that "=" needs to be "escaped" -- which it doesn't. It needs to be "url-encoded." ("Escaped" means something else with respect to FHIR search.)

We really shouldn't say anything about this at all (since the issue of url-encoding is pervasive and we never mention it elsewhere.) But if we do say something, it should be "url-encoded" -- and we should provide an example("that is, as %3D") to avoid confusion.

Background...

[10:31:10 PM] Richard Schneider: I'm just verifying that my server conforms to the spec.  Yes "?length<6" looks better, but how is less than or equal to represented.
Saturday, April 26, 2014
[1:11:52 AM] Grahame Grieve: Where did the \ come from?
[1:12:35 AM] Grahame Grieve: You will all be amused to know that I spent all afternoon setting fire to weeds. (Serrated tussock)
[1:41:31 AM] Richard Schneider: I love doing rural things.  A few months ago I burnt garden trash that was 3m high. Most versions of tussock in NZ are protected but did get to shoot a few possums.
[1:45:07 AM] Richard Schneider: As the spec (http://www.hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/search.html#number)  says `=` must be escaped.
[2:09:17 AM] Richard Schneider: Did `\` (back slash) remind u of "slashing" tussock?
[2:44:15 AM] Grahame Grieve: Richard - where do you live in nz?
[3:24:14 AM] Richard Schneider: NEW QUESTION: Is there a c# implementation of UCUM (Unified Code for Units of Measure_
[7:51:20 AM] Josh Mandel: Richard: the spec is certainly confusing on the "\" point, but your interpretation was wrong. What the spec *meant* to do was simply remind you that anytime you're embeding an "=" in a URL, you need to urlencode it,so the actual over-the-wire call is "Encounter?length=<%3D5"
[7:54:01 AM] Josh Mandel: I think putting a reminder there is odd + confusing though, because of course every parameter has to be url-encoded all the time. Like ... we don't write that "/Patient?identifier=http://acme.org/patient|2345" needs ot be escaped as "/Patient?identifier=http%3A%2F%2Facme.org%2Fpatient%7C2345" -- even though it does.
[7:55:29 AM] Josh Mandel: If we are going to have a reminder, it should say "`=` must e url-encoded" -- not "escaped", which is simply the wrong term (and used elsewhere in FHIR to mean something different.)

summary: Ambiguity in "is-a" regarding selectability of parent code
details:
There is ambiguity in the usage of the "is-a" filter operation (ValueSet.include.compose.filter.op) over whether the value given as a criterion is, itself, a member of the result set. In http://hl7.org/fhir/vs/condition-code, for example, which includes all child concepts of the Snomed "Clinical finding" code, it is clear that "Clinical finding" (code 404684003) itself should not be a valid selectable value - i.e. it should be considered abstract. For http://hl7.org/fhir/vs/specimen-container-type, on the other hand, "Specimen container" (code 434711009) should be selectable, with child concepts "Specimen well" and "Specimen vial" being refinements on the parent concept. There is currently no way to distinguish between these two cases.

One solution would be to divide "is-a" into "is-a", which explicitly includes the parent concept and "child-of" which does not.

The documentation for value set http://hl7.org/fhir/vs/body-site claims that it includes all the "Clinical finding" SNOMED CT codes. It then correctly mentions ID 91723000 and labels it as "Anatomical structure". There is no relationship between these two concepts. It should read:

This value set includes all the "Anatomical structure" SNOMED CT codes (i.e. codes with an is-a relationship with 91723000: Anatomical structure).

summary: The section on Transaction does not explain how a delete is rendered in a feed
details: The text on transaction says "The transaction interaction submits a set of resources to be updated, created or deleted on the server.", but does not refer to the representation of deletions using <deleted-entry> (this can only be found under the xml and json Bundle representations). Since the delete entry spec is new and unknown, it's worth adding a reference to that bit in the transaction spec.

summary: Clarify rules for data type contexts
details: Need to make clear that when referencing data types as contexts, references must be explicit - there is no inheritance.  For example, if the allows context is string, that doesn't mean the extension is allowed on "code" or "id"-typed elements.

summary: Summary table with REST operation does not document /Document correctly
details: The /Document endpoint acts as an endpoint for bundles of bundles, but searches are for Composition. We need to reflect that in the summary table.

Can we discuss inclusion of some explicit guidance re the use of If-Modified-Since HTTP header and 304 Not Modified response with RESTful API?  Strawman:

Clients using the If-Modified-Since HTTP header on request MUST accept 304 Not Modified as a valid response (unchanged content) or full content (changed content or unsupported).

This optimisation is relevant in reducing bandwidth for caching purposes and MAY be implemented by servers where this is a concern.  Servers can return 304 Not Modified where content is unchanged since the If-Modified-Since date-time specified or full content if not supported.

In all resources that have codings, the schematron files contain a rule like:

<sch:rule context="/f:AdverseReaction/f:symptom/f:code">
<sch:assert test="count(f:coding[f:primary/@value='true'])<1">Inv-2: Only one coding in a set can be chosen directly by the user</sch:assert>
</sch:rule>

This asserts that there can be at most 0 codings with primary=true.

This should actually be asserting that there can be at most 1 coding with primary=true.

summary: Profile pages do not have the Disqus comments footer on them
details:
The Disqus footer is not included on the Questionnaire extenstions page.

This is also the same on the Document Refence XDS profile page.

summary: Duplicate value set identifiers for http://hl7.org/fhir/v3/vs/VaccineType
details: There are two value sets in v3-codesystems.xml with the ID http://hl7.org/fhir/v3/vs/VaccineType. The second has a <version> element, and uses <compose><include> to include the code system defined in the first one.

summary: The atom identifiers in the value sets and profiles should all be correct
details: The value set references in the profiles are sometimes wrong, and the identifiers in the atom feed are consistently wrong. They should all align so code can resolve them

The DocumentReference.author needs to be allowed to be empty. The use-case are documents that existed prior to technology that are being scanned into electronic form.

Needed for XDS compatibility.

John Moehrke

summary: Adopt Template DSTU status codes in ResourceProfileStatus value set
details: Profiles are at the same level as V3 Templates. In the Template DSTU (obtainable in current ballot packages), there are a lot more statuses for Template life-cycle management. I cannot see why FHIR Profile would need less life-cycle management options so I suggest for FHIR Profile to adopt the same life-cycle management statuses as the Templates. (V3_TEMPLATESPEC_R1_D1_2014JAN.pdf)

summary: Put "Formats" on separate line and XML and JSON as sub-bullets
details: The way it renders, it's not clear that "Formats" is a separate link - so there's likely lots of people who aren't bothering to see how the content itself renders.  There's sufficient space based on the length of other sections to do this.

summary: Comparison with other HL7 specifications should be labeled "Appendix"
details: All of the other appendices have "Appendix:" at the beginning of their name.  Should be consistent.

summary: datatypes should use multi-tab approach like resources
details:
Having 4 links to the data types page is weird.  There's no reason why we couldn't have separate tabs for the main page, examples, definitions, mapping, profiles, etc. just like a regular resource page.  This would give consistency of feel to the spec and also give less clutter on the main page.  Plus it would be a bit more intuitive to hop between tabs than to have to jump back to the main page.

Recommend using a tabbed approach for examples for Extensibility too - plus any other page we introduce examples (or formal definitions or anything else for)

http://www.hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/valueset-administrative-gender.html

These codes raise huge confidentiality disclosure issues and are not a match to the administrative needs. Diagnoses like undifferentiated are among some of the most sensitive medical diagnoses, and do not belong in widely disseminated information.

The HL7 V2.x codes correspond to normal practice:

M - Use male assigned administrative practices, e.g., for room assignments.
F - Use female assigned administrative practices, e.g., for room assignments.
U - Administrative practices not yet selected. Typical for early trauma cases where treatment proceeds without waiting for identification details like sex determination.
N - Sex related administrative practices do not apply to this patient. This can arise when patient is also used to track inanimate objects.
O - Other (rare) for special cases with other administrative practices.

I expect this list would be extended for veterinary uses, where things like stall assignment may be different for free martin, martingale, heifer, cow, steer, and bull.

The code "N" is from HL7 v2.x.  This could also be "O".  I've seen it used primarily for quality phantoms, etc.  These should go through the same software as patients, since the software is an important part of the quality test, but don't have a meaningful sex category.  I don't know the full rationale behind this original choice.  I assume it's because there are occasionally real humans with special needs and they didn't want to mix them in with the inanimate test subjects.

summary: Conformance does not indicate support for tags
details:
The conformance resource does not indicate any support for tags on the server.

One way to correct this would be a boolean flag on the Rest element. Another way might be a new code added to the system-restful-operation valueset.

One way or the other, the Conformance resource should be a complete description of the server's capabilities, so this should be corrected.

summary: Add reference on FHIR Resources page back to FHIR Resource and Profile Proposals
details:
