Add reference on FHIR Resources page back to FHIR Resource and Profile Proposals.

Difficult to determine what new resources are under consideration from the DSTU page.

summary: Value set needs changes to align with the Value Set Definition Process
details:
The value set specification project has described the basic metadata for a value set. The ValueSet resource does not happily align with this, and should be changed to do so. 

For specific details, see Vocab committee minutes, 5-May 2014 Q3

summary: Need rules for tags invalidated by an update
details:
The current rules for update around tags are as follows:

"The server stores all the tags provided in the headers, and keeps any tags already associated with the resource"

However, some update operations may invalidate tags.  For example a "reviewed by clinician" tag on a lab result would be invalidated if the lab result were corrected.  Similarly, some security tags might be invalidated when the resource content is updated.  Suggest adding the following to the existing rule text:

"In some cases, an update may invalidate existing tags.  Servers may update or remove previously existing recognized tags if this is known to be appropriate."

Tags on documents are a little bit special.  Documents are the only atom feed that has a lifespan outside the transmission from sender to final receiver.  Because they are persisted and may be retrieved long after they have been created, they behave somewhat like resources.  The need to tag them for workflow reasons, security reasons, profile reasons, etc. is the same as for resources.  This tagging can occur if the Document endpoint is used or if the document is stored as a Binary.  An explanation is needed that explains that this sort of tagging is possible and differentiates it from the tags that are included within the atom feed of the document itself which are immutable and "locked" for the existence of the document.  This explanation should provide guidance on when it's actually appropriate to include tags inside the document (given that the primary purpose of tags is to allow independent change from the tagged object).

Advice coming out of the Connectathon is that two resources is cleaner than one.  One would cover the "form" - the design aspect.  The second would cover completed questionnaires (the "data").  Current proposed names are QuestionnaireDefinition and QuestionnaireAnswers.  (Would Form and FormData be better?)

summary: Each of the sub-category headers in the resources.html page should be hyperlinks
details:
As new content is being added to the likes of the Administration.html to better explain the relationships between the scheduling resources at a higher level, we would like to see the sub category headers be hyperlinks to direct users to that content.

(At present there is a small amount of text around the appointment scheduling resources, but PA plans to extend this with extended explanatory text describing the interaction between the 4 resources, and likely include a simple UML diagram between these top level FHIR resources.

In HL7 v3, we had a standard set of names like "Eve Everywoman" that were obviously "fake".  The reason for this was to make it clear that none of the examples were real clinical data.  I'm not a huge fan of Eve Everywoman.  However, we probably do need a declaration somewhere that says something like this:

"The examples reflected in this specification do *not* represent actual people.  Any resemblance to real people - alive or dead - is entirely coincidental.  In some cases, examples may be drawn from real clinical data.  However, if this has occurred, the content has been scrubbed to remove any identifying information."

The Patient Administration (PA) group requests a change of the name for the data type "Schedule". The group is working on a resource for the scheduling domain that requires the same name by definition. The current resource name "Availability" confuses not only new but experienced standards developers and system implementer. 

The PA group appreciates the support of this change request and suggests the following alternatives for the data type: "Recurrence", "Timing", "Timetable". We believe those names fit the definition of the data type better than the "Schedule".

summary: Profile XML & JSON isn't populating the license info
details: It should be, just to make it clear to implementers

summary: Incorrect FHIR valueset for the message.code element under 2.3.5 Event List
details: Please update the FHIR valueset for the message.code element under 2.3.5 Event List. The reference should be http://hl7.org/fhir/message-events per the MessageHeader resource 6.2.9.1 Terminology Bindings section.

summary: Add clarification to value set QA rules
details:
Clarification about where v3 codes fit in this hierarchy 
- what v2 and v3 codes are appropriate for consideration and when should they be preferred over something like value set
Balance of use of external vs. human readability
Are the rules different for "code" vs. other attributes

summary: Versionable objects in FHIR need an "effectiveTime"
details: In the templates DSTU there is the notion of "effectiveTime" which conveys the timestamp when the versionable object came into being. It is connected to the workflow, where you go from "new" to "draft" (or later).

summary: Profile.date should have a more meaningful name
details: Profile.date is documented to be the date on which the profile is published, however we think the name badly reflects this. Suggestion: "publication" : instant

summary: Binding for Profile.structure.type is incorrectly described as "Incomplete" in Profile.html
details:
http://hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/profile.html says:
Profile.structure.type    Either a resource or a data type    Incomplete    http://hl7.org/fhir/valueset/defined-types

But http://hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/defined-types.html says:
Profile.structure.type (Fixed)

The former is incorrect (should be "Fixed", not "Incomplete").

summary: Need standard extensions for description and category
details:
Description identifies what the form can be used for.  It is useful for distinguishing between multiple forms and deciding which one you actually want to use.  The category covers things like pediatric, admission, oncology, etc.  It helps group forms and helps find the one that's relevant.

Recommendation from Connectathon is that these be handled as extensions rather than core.

summary: Need common extensions for controls on data elements
details:
QuestionnaireDefinition.group.question, ObservationDefinition and Profile.structure.element.definition need the ability to identify additional constraints on the permitted data value.  These include:

field sizes (default & max width, default & max height)

How groups get rendered (list, table, etc.)

Question answer is "read only" (only on QuestionnaireAnswer)

Minimum and maximum length

Eegular expression

Number of decimal places

summary: Need standard on whether Encounter is referenced everywhere
details: Some resources reference Encounter, others don't.  Some of those that do reference Encounter, it's not necesariliy in the 80% for existing systems (e.g. Questionnaire).  Need a policy on whether Encounter should just be a "standard" element for clinical resources or not,  Alternative is a standard extension that can appear on any resource that doesn't already have an encounter link

summary: Questionnaire.group.subject is questionable from an 80% perspective
details: This relates to subject vs. recordTarget.  However, still not clear that many questionnaire systems will have the ability to identify specific resource references as the "subject" of particular sections.

This is better handled as a specific question so that there's control over when remarks are allowed or not.

Recommendation from connectathon is to remove

summary: example of JSON is using Person not Patient
details: The example showing json representation of elements is using Person - not Patient, is missing resourceType and has the type as a root element...

Currently, ValueSet.compose.include contains a code element which has a code datatype (i.e. a string) which is not associated with a display representation. I suggest we replace the code element with concept element which is defined with a similar structure as ValueSet.define.concept - essentially including a mandatory code element (of type code), an optional display element  (of type string).

The display element shall be populated with the representation of the string the value set author would like adopters of the Value Set to use. This may be the term (e.g. fully specified name, synonym, etc.) in the source of the code (e.g. a a terminology like SNOMED-CT), or it may be something assigned by the author (e.g. when the source of the code does not provide an acceptable display representation).

When wanting to record the clinical details of a 'consultation', you'd generally use the SOAP (Subjective, Objective, Assessment, Plan) model. It would make sense to use the Observation resource to record both Subjective (what the patient said) and Objective (what the clinciian saw) which means that the observation.perfomer property needs to be able to refer to a Patient resource.
If there's a desire to capture the reason for not answering a question, that should be part of the questionnaire design.  It's not something that should be captured anywhere and everywhere.

summary: Conformance statement doesn't belong in example
details:
The text says:

"E.g. if the data is captured as a physician-agreed (electronic) form, it might be impossible or undesirable to distill separate resources from it, and the Questionnaire SHALL be stored and communicated as a whole."

It doesn't make sense to include a SHALL here a it's an example.

ValueSet.name and ValueSet.description have a minimum cardinality of 1.  However, those are "good practice" constraints as opposed to "must be present for any use" constraints.  There are lots of legacy value sets in systems as well as legacy data elements that involve contained value sets where no name or description exists and where such information is unnecessary.  The constraints should be relaxed.  If we want to define a Profile enforcing good practices that applies to all FHIR-defined value sets, that's fine.

summary: Value set for name-qualifier value set is too broad
details: The value set includes PFX and SFX.  However, these are handled by other means in FHIR and shouldn't be sent in the extension.  A custom value set should be created that excludes these two codes.

§2.1.14 appears to have spelling error in the URL. "history" should be "_history"
<link href="[base]/Patient/34/history/31" rel="predecessor-version"/>

summary: A profile should be able to declare its authoritative URL to be used when referencing extensions, search parameters, etc.
details:
Currently there's no way to actually say, in a profile, what the full extensions URLs should be. There's only a way to express the fragment (#) portion.

This means that hosting a profile on different servers changes its meaning -- and you can't share profiles by email, ftp, skype, etc. Because when I see a profile, I can't tell what URL to use for extensions.

 

Proposal:Define a Profile.authoritativeUrl that allows a Profile to declare its authoritative URL explicitly: this URL should be used when referencing extensions, search parameters, etc. It can be optional, with fallback to the current (hosting-dependent) behavior.

summary: Profiles should default to extension definitions
details: At present, when the content of a profile is generated from the spreadsheet, the short, formal, comment and other descriptive text is all inherited from the definition of "extension" and "modifierExtension" rather than being taken from the extension definition.  The content should be taken only from the extension definition.

summary: period attribute for Contact resource element.
details: Suggest addition of a "contact.period" element for the contact resource element as contacts can change based on a timre period. There are even situations wherein contacts have an anticipated change based on time period. This seems like a fairly commonplace need. This came up as a v2 mapping need for NK1-8 (Start Date) and NK1-9 (End Date) to indicate next of kin.

The line: 

o The request content type submitted is always a bundle containing a message or document resource as the first resource

should read 

o The request content type submitted is always a bundle containing a messageHeader or composition resource as the first resource

summary: when submitting a tracker item from the spec, open tracker in a new window
details: When clicking on the 'propose a change' link at the bottom of each page in the spec, the 'new tracker item' page is displayed - which is cool. However, the page opens in the same browser window - and you often want to refer back to the page when documenting the proposed change. Opening in a new window would make it easier to create the change proposal.

In the system I'm bridging to it gives me a URL to the patient's photo.  Which I add to the Patient.photo.  With XSD validation I get an error that contentType is not specified.  I don't know the media type. Should I just set it to "application/octets"

Should we consider making the contentType optional when an URL is specified?

summary: Profiles for behaviour of document post to mailbox
details: Please define some profiles for Conformance.rest.documentMailbox. The profiles are needed to specify the server's behaviour when processing a posted document to the mailbox. I thinking we need profiles for "resend document", "add as REST resource(s)", "add as binary" and "adds a document reference"

http://www.hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/documentreference-definitions.html#DocumentReference.hash does not mention the hashing algorithm nor encoding for DocumentReference.hash.  It should include " HexBinary representation of SHA1".
In an Attachment,  the contentType should be optional when the url is specified.  It should be required when data is specified.

summary: The encoding of hash is inconsistent
details: The encoding of hash is inconsistent.  In an Attachment it is base64 and in DocumentReference its HexBinary.  I suggest that all hashes are encoded as HexBinary.

Alter.note has the cardinality 1..1. An Alert can be represented with a code which is better for machine processing. I recognize that not always everybody is able to express an alert with code, and therefore note element is needed. But in case a code is included, note becomes optional if needed at all. Change proposal:

Downgrade the cardinality of note to 0..1

Add a code (codeableConcept) in Alert, with cardinality 0..1

Add a constraint that at least note or code must exist

The binding for docStatus has a link to http://hl7.org/fhir/vs/composition-status.html, which 404's.

I believe the correct link is http://hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/composition-status.html
Need  XSD for TagList, which has two reqiuired fields term and scheme.

summary: Add a warning about the safety implications of not conforming to the specification
details:
From William Goosen via Grahame: 

"I would like to work on some statement where the user is made aware of the patient safety issues he is loading upon him/herself when codes are changed en hence semantic interoperability is broken."

Grahame's comment: yes, users are allowed to clone the spec and do whatever they want with it. The only thing they're not allowed to do if they do that is claim to be conformant to FHIR. But we don't anywhere specifically say that this is actually a bad idea for safety or interoperability, and it would be a good idea to do that.

summary: Binary resources can be subverted for cross-site scripting
details:
We should say something to this effect at /security.html :

Another important security consideration for FHIR: bad things can happen if you store /Binary documents on the same domain (or a subdomain of) where you keep user session cookies. For example, an attacker can create a binary document that serves up with content-type "text/html" and has content like "<script>send_to_attacker(document.cookie);</script>". 

Case in point:  http://fhir.healthintersections.com.au/open/Binary/badness/_history/3 

I just uploaded this resource; if I can trick anyone into viewing it, it display their cookies in an alert box. (To be clear: this version is safe for you to view; but a malicious version would send those cookies off somewhere bad).

Possible mitigations incldue:
1. Don't host your FHIR API on a domain where you also use browser-based session cookies for authentication
    1a. don't use cookie-based auth for FHIR API calls
    1b. host your API on a separate subdomain from your Web UI
2. Always respond to "GET /Binary/anything" with a "Content-Disposition: attachment;" header

summary: link element within a deleted-entry element uses the incorrect namespace
details:
deleted-entry is defined in our schemas (tombstone.xsd) as an element in the "http://purl.org/atompub/tombstones/1.0" namespace (which is correct), but the nested <link> elements are also defined to be in that namespace. This is incorrect: Both the tombstone spec itself and section 1.12.5.1.1.2 clearly indicate tombstone reuses the <link> element from the atom namespace.

From RFC6721:

deletedEntry = element at:deleted-entry { atomCommonAttributes, attribute ref { atomUri }, attribute when { atomDateConstruct }, ( element at:by { atomPersonConstruct }? & element at:comment { atomTextConstruct }? & element atom:link { atomLink }* & element atom:source { atomSource }? & anyElement* ) }

summary: Add additional notes to the RESTful API about security
details:
We should add some additional information about security and the RESTful API. Specifically:

"The choice of whether to return 403 or 404 depends upon the specific situation and specific local policies, regulations, and laws.The decision of which error to use will include consideration of whether disclosure of the existence of relevant records is considered an acceptable disclosure of PI or  a prohibited disclosure of PI"

Also, note that chained search implementations need to observe the restrictions on a user in the chained search, and that it would be normal to simply omit resources from the search if they aren't visible, but a server may elect to add an operationOutcome to indicate that additional resources may be available if other access tokens are used (e.g. break the glass)

summary: Add start and end dates for alert resource
details: I am designing a national patient alerts and notification service for use in NHS Wales. I would like to base my design around FHIR principles, but the existing alert resource is lacking in several features, principally start and end dates. These are required so that the server can reply to alert requests by only sending those alerts which are current, and have not yet expired.

Guidance is required on how to create a Security Event when a tag operation is involved.

My proposal can be found at https://gist.github.com/richardschneider/8e1466c5cab2f7c31167

Following up on question on the mailing list regarding best practice for logical operators in a query string, Consider adopting the convention defined in the OData 4.0 URL Conventions (OASIS).

http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.0/os/part2-url-conventions/odata-v4.0-os-part2-url-conventions.html#_Toc372793790

2.2.4.2 External References

If the _include path selects a reference that refers to a resource on another server, the server can element to include that resource in the search results for the convenience of the client.

-> 'element' should be 'elect'

summary: Patient/RelatedPerson/Organization search key 'phonetic' lacks path definition
details: The ponetic seach parameter of the Patient, RelatedPerson, and Organization resources have no path definition. It should have a path of Patient.name / RelatedPerson.name / Organization.name.

summary: Clarify how to use RBAC and ABAC using FHIR
details:
FHIR is RBAC ready -

- FHIR Resources are object-types, CRUD are operations  ==> Permissions are operations on object-types

- Roles (Structural and/or Functional) are groups of Users, and

- Roles group Permissions.

- Thus any User that is in a named Role possesses the Permissions assigned to that Role.

FHIR is ABAC ready

- Instances of a resource in FHIR can have security-tags associated with it.

- These security-tags are consistant with the HL7 HCS -- Healthcare Privacy&Security Classication System

-These security-tags classify (tag) the instance of the object-type using the vocabulary defined in the HCS

-- For example: The identified object is to be used only for the PurposeOfUse of Treatment

-- For example: The identified object is not to be further disclosed without explicit consent from the patient

- This system is shown in use for XDS/XDR/XDM through the HL7 DS4P IG

- Use of the sensitivity classification vocabulary should not be used unless there is clear protection of the tags as well as the object.

In a CCDA document we had a document where an encounter participant had multiple addresses. However the Practitioner resource allows only a single address. We used an extension for now, but wonder if address should be multiple.

The tool does not seem pick the name column of a structure when generating a profile. One example: I profiled the MessageHeader for a set of specific messages, and my spreadsheet starts at the first row "Profile Name"=ADT_Message, "Element"=MessageHeader, "Type"=Resource, ....

I expect that ADT_Message goes to structure.name in the profile generated. But acutally both of type and name elements of the structure element are set to MessageHeader.

summary: FHIR Publish Tools - html rendering issue
details:
Publish tool seems like not always handle html rendering of profile content correctly. For constraints placed to the element of the base resource, it sometimes renders both the base element (which is to be contreained) and the constrained spec. This behvaior can be vary depending on the order of all elements in spreadsheet (but they still conform to the nested element path order as specified). When I moved around the order of the constrained elements, some of the rendering errors gone.

I always list extensions first, followed by constrained element.

The example "conceptmaps.xml" contains a number of <map> elements that 'narrow'.  According the schematron a <comment> element must be present.  For example:

        <concept>
          <system value="http://hl7.org/fhir/name-use"/>
          <code value="old"/>
          <map>
            <system value="http://hl7.org/fhir/v2/0200"/>
            <code value="NOUSE"/>
            <equivalence value="narrower"/>
          </map>

needs to add <comments value="some reason for narrower"/> to the <map>.

The schematron error is " If the map is narrower, there SHALL be some comments.", which is confusing.  A better error message may be needed.

Per Llyod's advice on question I posted on missing search parameter paths for the SecurityEvent resource I propose the following change:

In addition to defiinng a 'path' for a search parameter to indicate the precise extent of the resource data used to determine a match using the well-defined resource-independent search keys and qualifiers, FHIR needs a model-driven way to specify a resource-specific algorithm used with some search parameter to account for a few of the search scenarios that have been defined without a specific search paramter path.

Candidates in the DSTU 1 (Search parameters with no search key) include:

* ImagingStudy: size
* Location: near & nearDistance
* Organization: phonetic
* Patient: phonetic
* RelatedPerson: phonetic
* SecurityEvent: patientId

Location's near and nearDistance is a good example as the alogorithm for detemrining 'nearness' could be based on included GPS coordinates or inferred from a street address, etc.  so its not entirely clear which element(s) of the resource would or could represent the 'path' for that parameter.

Problem: Without some additional metainformation it is unclear if a path is missing because the model is incomplete or if a missing path is supposed to imply a search parameter with a resource-specific matchign algorithm.  For model-driven code generators a little more metainfo in the model would help.

Proposed Solution: To make the intent of the model defining this resource precise adding metadata to the model to indicate that the parameter's mathcing logic is 'resource specific' and defined in the definition comment.  With this metainfo a generated implementation knows a general purpose resource-independent matching algorithm (like a string match or date range search on a particular element) won't suffice and that one specific to that named parameter on that particular resource will need to be used at runtime and supplied by the implementator (i.e. not generated).   

And, if we expect there is a future need to support multiple named matching algorithms for the same logical named search parameter that could be handled without further modification to FHIR metamodel by creating separate named parameters with different suffixes indicating the different matching algorithm.  This would avoid formally introducing support into the metamodel for multiple runtime-selectable named algorithms on the same logical search parameter, something that, so far anyway, appears to be very rare in the FHIR model.

Affected Resources: Potentially impacts the 6 resources listed above.  I can't tell if they all count as resource-specific search parameters, but these 6 are the resources that have some empty search paths and are potential candidates for marking as 'resource-specific' search parameters.

7 of 8 examples use contained resources instead of external resources.  Is this intentional?  

 Section 1.12.3.3  Contained Resources  states  " In some circumstances, the content referred to in the resource reference does not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains it In some circumstances, the content referred to in the resource reference does not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains it...This SHOULD NOT be done when the content can be identified properly, as once the " 

So by making virtually all the examples have contained resources  a) suggests that its always the case that the inline content like diagnostic order or observation or patient don't have an independeent existence and b) that this an acceptable way to send reports instead of resource bundles and 3) since developers are prone to copying examples rather than reading the fat spec, this is setting a bad precedent.

I propose removing contained resources from all but 1 or 2 of examples, putting the external references in the appropriate Diagnostic Report elements and providing and example or 3 of an atom feed for a Diagnostic report that include all the referenced resources.
The version history page has three sections numbered 1.4.

summary: encounter-reason valueset link in Appointment documentation is broken
details: The link to http://hl7.org/fhir/vs/encounter-reason 404s. The ID in valuesets.xml for this value set is given as http://hl7.org/fhir/valueset/encounter-reason in entry.id, but http://hl7.org/fhir/vs/encounter-reason in entry.content.ValueSet.identifier.

The Tag:

~~Keep information from patient: http://hl7.org/fhir/v3/ActCode#TABOO

About a year ago effort was made to remove the use of the term TABOO in favour of a more appropriate term. Suggest this Tag term be changed to reflect the outcome of that effort.
~~~~When a profile redefines a binding, it can redefine the binding - suggest removing the 'it can redefine the binding'.

ValueSet defines the following search param called "code":

---
code
token
A code defined in the value set
ValueSet.define.concept.code
---

But the element path appears to be incorrect: shouldn't it be "ValueSet.define.concept" rather than "ValueSet.define.concept.code"?

The Observation class allows you to search for related-target.  This will be most useful for chaining.  E.g. Find me the blood pressures that have a systolic value in a particular range.  (Where you want back the full blood pressure, not just the systolic measurement.)  However, to do this properly, you want to constrain the type of the relationship.  There's no way to do that right now.

As well, we should indicate whether the search recurses.  For example, it may not always be certain whether the target observation will be nested one or two or even three levels deep within a compositional structure.  (This is a theoretical issue - I don't have a specific example, so it's possible it's not a real problem.)
.scopes[Role](classCode=IDENT) is not a coherent mapping

summary: Need to clarify what's in-scope for resources vs. profiles
details: Structured data like blood pressure, complex procedures, etc. can all be encoded with different levels of detail - and sometimes even with different nesting structures.  We need to make clear that the resources don't standardize all of this (and can't, for a variety of reasons) and that where standardization on this is necessary for interoperability, it will come from Profiles.

To support search across documents, a DocumentReference should have a "keywords" property, with cardinality 0..*, of CodeableConcepts. And a "keywords" search parameter should be added, referncing this property.

This would allow indexing arbitrary documents (e.g. binary data, images) by key terms.
Conformance.messaging.reliableCache is a "length" but no units are specified.  Is this in minutes or seconds or just the number of messages that are cached?

summary: Message endpoints should be associated with the event protocol
details:
I'm confused about Conformance.messaging.endpoint and Conformance.message.event.protocol.  Would not each supported protocol have a different endpoint.  If doing MLLP it would be "tcp://host:port" but if FTP then endpoint is "ftp://host". 

I expect the endpoint to be associated with the protocol.  So we should remove endpoint from Conformance.messaging and add a Conformance.message.event.endpoint.

summary: Why is Specimen.collection 1..1 when everything on it is 0..1?
details:
Why is Specimen.collection 1..1 when everything on it is 0..1?

collected[x] would be required for specimen based observations  ( is currenlty 0..1)  but in the base resource is this a necessary constraint.?

summary: value set name for composition.class is confusing
details: The name of the value set "Value Set http://hl7.org/fhir/vs/xds-typecodes" for composition.class is confusing since there is a composition.type element as well which has a value set "http://hl7.org/fhir/vs/doc-codes". I propose changing the name of the value set to doc-classcodes and doc-typecodes or something like that to remove this potential source of confusion.

summary: Observation should enable linking to an Encounter
details:
Josh Mandel: I'd like to link Observation --> Encounter. For example, I record a blood pressure observation at an encounter, but have no way to say which encounter. Has anyone else run into this?
[9:46:11 AM] James Agnew: We just added an extension for this
[9:46:54 AM] James Agnew: On both diagnosticreport and observation.

summary: If history is not supported, return 501, not 410
details: In section 2.1.7, when a server does not maintain history, it is expected to respond with HTTP response code 405. This seems inappropriate as the server is also required to return a list of valid HTTP methods for the resource. Since the resource is gone, there are no appropriate methods to execute on it. 410 may be appropriate as stated in the section when it is deleted or 501 for Not Implemented.

summary: Objective-C Reference Implementation from Download page is broken
details:
The Objective-C reference implementation posted on the downloads page (http://www.hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/downloads.html) is broken. It looks like it was built on a Windows system using the FHIR build tools, which messes up the file separators & file names for OS X. I tried to manually rename/reorganize the files, but I couldn't make XCode happy.

The only solution seems to be to actually build FHIR on OS X, and then import it into XCode. I'd be glad to submit my working build/XCode project. Please let me know if there's any specific instructions for packaging the code.

Also, it would be really handy to make this into a CocoaPod (http://cocoapods.org). Again, I'd be glad to do so, but that would make me the owner of the library.

MedicationAdministration uses "whengiven" as a search parameter while MedicationStatement uses "when-given". This could possibly be unified to use one or the other.

Given than in both profiles the "whenGiven" property is a period but the search parameter is a date, would it make sense to rename this to "date-given" or similar? MedicationPrescription has a parameter "datewritten", a possible source of inspiration (and a possible candidate for renaming to "date-written").

summary: Disconnect between authoring template and Profile for messaging artifacts
details: The spreadsheet allows multiple resources to be specified on both request and response, but has no place to capture the profile associated with either request or response.  It also allows capturing both a description and notes.  On the other hand, Conformance.messaging.event has 1..1 focus instead of 1..*, identifies no information about the focus for response resources and requires profiles for both request and response.  It also only has a slot for documentation with no ability to differentiate description from notes.

> 1.2.2 FHIR License
>
> Copyright (C) 2014 HL7.
>
> This document is produced and distributed by HL7 under the terms of
> HL7® [[Governance and Operations Manual]] relating to Intellectual
> (Section 16), specifically its copyright, trademark and patent provisions.
>
> This document is licensed under Creative Commons "No Rights Reserved" ([[CC0]]).
>
> "HL7" and "FHIR" are registered trademarks of HL7.
>

> 1.2.3 Additional information about the license:
> 
> * FHIR is © and ® HL7. The right to maintain FHIR remains vested in HL7
> * You can redistribute FHIR
> * You can create derivative specifications or implementation-related products and services

> * Neither HL7 nor any of the contributors to this specification accept any liability for your use of FHIR

 

+ also we need to add the LOINC usage notice at the end of the page as well

summary: Include isSummary attribute in Profile definitions
details:
It seems like it would make sense to define what data clients should expect to have access to for summary records. A mark at f:Profile/f:structure/f:element/f:definition/f:isSummary/@value would be consistent with the design.

Add an isSummary element to the FHIR element definition. This value should default to False.

Example

  <element>
    <path value="Patient.name"/>
    <definition>
      <short value="A name associated with the patient"/>
      <formal value="A name associated with the individual."/>
      <comments value="Person may have multiple names with different uses or applicable periods.For animals, the name is a "HumanName" in the sense that is assigned and used by humans and has the same patterns."/>
      <min value="0"/>
      <max value="*"/>
      <type>
        <code value="HumanName"/>
      </type>
      <isModifier value="false"/>
      <isSummary value="true"/>
      <mapping>
        <identity value="rim"/>
        <map value="name"/>
      </mapping>
      <mapping>
        <identity value="v2"/>
        <map value="PID-5, PID-9"/>
      </mapping>
    </definition>
  </element>

The instance attribute in the ImagingStudy resource has currently a cardinality requirement of 1..X, which requires instance information is populated when the series level information is sent in the resource. In order to use this resource to serve image information query, a query request may instruct the provider to only return imaging study information to the series level. Becasue a series can contain a large number of instances, and a client may be interested only in series level information to list all studies / series, a query response with ImagingStudy resource populated information only in study and series level reduce the message size significantly and therefore improve the query response performance.

The proposal is to release the cardinality requirement of ImagingStudy.series.instance to 0..X. If some application needs to enforce inclusion of instance level information, constraint can be applied in a profile.

summary: Base profiles use Profile's ElementDefinition.nameReference is a path, not a name reference
details:
In the base Profiles (e.g. http://www.hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/questionnaire.profile.xml.html), an elementDefn's "nameReference" is filled out with a full path, however the Profile spec says this should be a symbolic name (referring to Element.name). Invariant 2 is actually validating this, so all base Profiles should not pass validation currently.

I would like to change "nameReference" to be a path, not a name, since otherwise every developer has to resolve this name to the path anyway (so it's better the publication tool/authoring tools do this instead).

summary: Questionnaire needs to inform the reader that Security/Privacy is dependent on specific questionnaire content
details: The generic Questionnaire is a good example where the reader of the FHIR spec might need specific guidance, specifically that the content of the specific Questionnaire they are building needs to be assessed, as FHIR can’t pre-judge all possible questioners against Privacy and Security impact. For example the core specification supports a Questionnaire that is very minimal and thus would not have any privacy impact, and possibly not have even much security impact. The Questionnaire could also be gathering highly sensitive and patient specific.

It is not currently possible to search for fields in Encounter.hospitalization. The relevant fields should be considered for addition to the list of search parameters supported for Encounter, including at least:

- Encounter.hospitalization.period
- Encounter.hospitalization.accommodation.bed
- Encounter.hospitalization.accommodation.period

A case could also be made for:

- Encounter.hospitalization.specialArrangement

in cases where a system wants to compile a list of patients currently requiring a particular service ("Which currently admitted patients need a translator?")

summary: Relationship between Encounter.location and Encounter.hospitalization.accommodation is unclear
details: Both Encounter.location and Encounter.hospitalization.accommodation capture information on a patient's location, in cases where the patient is hospitalized. One can speculate that the location field should be used to represent a locatioon at the level of a ward, and the accommodation to specify a particular location within the first specified location, but the implementer shouldn't be required to speculate. The documentation should make clear what the relationship is between these two fields.
Add a time data type for recording a time during the day, where the day itself is not known. Requests for this functionality from multiple sources including the SDC project.

bodySite is ambiguous - is it target body site, or approach body site? the mapping is to targetSiteCode, but the definition is not sufficiently clear about this. But there doesn't appear to be any strongly identified use cases for this property on observation to justify it's existence. 

Need to consider the use cases that drove it's adoption later in v2, but it smells like an extension

There's no clear explanation of the reason for both Encounter.period and Encounter.hospitalization.period.  At minimum, there needs to be  a clear explanation of the difference for both.  However, dropping hospitalizatin.period is also possible, as it's not clear that both are in the 80%.

Encounter.location.period is currently mandatory, and I believe it shouldn't be.

Per the encounter definition:

> Encounter instances may exist before the actual encounter takes place to convey pre-admission information, including using Encounters elements to reflect the planned start date, planned accommodation or planned encounter locations. In this case the status element is set to 'planned'.

A common use case (I believe) is for pre-admission encounters to be registered, where the location is known but the time is not yet known. Certainly at a minimum this is a workflow that my own organization supports.

At present the valueset for Patient.contact.relationship says:

This value set defines its own terms in the system http://hl7.org/fhir/patient-contact-relationship

emergency - "Emergency Contact" : for use in case of emergency family - "Family" :
guardian - "Guardian" :
friend - "Friend" :
partner - "Partner" :
work - "Work Contact" : for matters related to the patients occupation/employment caregiver - "Caregiver" : (Non)professional caregiver agent - "Agent" : Contact that acts on behalf of the patient guarantor - "Guarantor" : Contact for financial matters owner - "Owner of animal" : For animals, the owner of the animal parent - "Parent" : Parent of the patient

This is not much of a value set, it seems to me. I'd like to at least broaden it a little, and also increase it's granularity, though I'm not sure how far we should go there. Also, it violates our general principle that this isn't the sort of value set FHIR resources should define for themselves if there's any choice.

These hierarchies out of RoleClass seem like they should be considered:

GT
RESPRSN
NOK (an orphan all out by itself - why?) _PersonalRelationshipRoleType

These role codes cover additional scope:
* power of attorney

extra granularity that appears to matter
* inverse of parent

OTOH, the role codes don't appear to cover:
* the notion of a general emergency contact
* work contact
* caregiver
* owner

Finally, none of these codes cover the concept that made me start this
consideration:
* mother of an as yet unborn child | child of a mother before birth (and/or newly born)

I particularly think we need an explicit code for this concept.

At present, you can report a qualification type (using code). but many qualifications come with a specific identifier that confers the rights associated with the qualification. This should be a specific element "identifier". Also the definition for Practitioner.qualification.code is ambiguous - does it describe the qualification, or the type of the qualification?

summary: Allow a practitioner to be associated with more than one organization
details:
The existing practitioner resource has 0..1 organisation, the organization the practiioner represents

In RIM terms, this is  an entity playing a role scoped by an organization entity

This doesn't match the way people actually implement practitioner in their systems - a single record for the person, with relationships to multiple organizations. Forcing organizations to clone the practitioner record for different organisations has disastrous effects on mappings, on audit trails, on maintenance procedures, and on basic sense.

This needs to be fixed so that a single practitioner has multiple associations with organizations. So: make organiation a complex element, and move period, telecom and address in there. And maybe role

Note: why isn't this a problem in CDA? because people just name whatever organisation is relevant for the practitioner a the time, but provide the same identifier each time. This implicitly violates the RIM semantics, but is not testable.

summary: Source should be removed from Provenance Agent Role valueset
details:
The agent role value set includes

source: An information source from which the portions of the resource are derived

May be an electronic document, application, paper record, etc. *Not* a person

The note means that this is not an agent role, but an entity role - it's already there, so just remove it from this list

summary: Supply.kind is bound to SupplyType value set - should harmonize terms
details: Supply.kind is bound to SupplyType value set - should harmonize terms. Propose either .type or value set name "SupplyKind"

summary: Description for code medication is Central Supply
details: This looks like a copy and paste from SupplyType. Description should be 'Medication' not 'Central Supply'

summary: Generalize definiation so includes more that medications
details:
Porpose the following changes:

1)

Supply.dispense.suppliedItem: Definition: Identifies the medication, substance or device being dispensed. This is either a link to a resource representing the details of the item of the medication or substance or a simple attribute carrying a code that identifies the item medication from a known list of items medications.

2)

~~Supply.dispense.supplier
Definition The individual responsible for dispensing the medication, substance or device.

~~Supply.dispense.whenHandedOver
Definition The time the dispensed item was sent or handed to the patient (or agent).
Control 0..1
Type Period

Should be dateTime  -- how long does it take to hand over a supply?  no way to say  today at noon.

~~Style Guide

URL operations on this pages are defined like this:
  OPERATION [base]/[type]/[id] {?_format=[mime-type]}

•The first word is the HTTP verb used for the operation
•Content surrounded by [] is mandatory, and will be replaced the string literal identified. Possible insertion values: ◦base: The Service Root URL
◦mime-type: The Mime Type


I think "mime-type" should be "type" and the associated links should be ammended as well.

summary: Add identifier search parameter for Observation
details: Need to be able search by identifier, so add "identifier" search parameter

Specimen needs search parameters for:

identifier = identifier
type = type
source = source.target
accession = accessionIdentifier
collected = collection.collected
collector = collection.collector ?
site = collection.sourceSite
containerid = container.identifier
container = container.type

summary: Answer format doesn't cover all types supported by QuestionnaireAnswers
details: QuestionnaireAnswers allows complex data types and resource references.  Need to have a way to support that.

summary: Add a security user and management subsystem
details: As discussed here: http://wiki.hl7.org/index.php?title=FHIR_Security_Management_Subsystem
JSON example contains: "text": "Chief Red Cloud"/>

summary: Missing quote in JSON element name
details:
~~"name" : {
  "extension: [
should be

~~"name" : {
  "extension": [

summary: Add language search parameter to Practioner
details: I was trying to write a query to find the Practitioners that speak the language of the Patient.  Both Patient and Practitioner have the communication element.  But its only searchable on a Patient via "language"!

As discussed on the mailing list, create a data element:

 dataAbsentReason [0..1] : code (DataAbsentReason - see
http://hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/data-absent-reason.html)

And review the data absent reason list. 

For full discussion, see FHIR/OO email thread entitled ""Keystroke Error" is not a urine color (null values in FHIR Observations)"

This was requested by ClinicalGenomics as quite often only ages (or age ranges) are captured and converting between ages and birth dates is awkward.  While birth dates provide the benefit of time-independence of family history, this is not common practice.

This was approved by CG on a con-call in early July.

summary: Disconnect between Questionnaire and QuestionnaireAnswers on data type
details:
The Questionnaire resource provides a coded structure to identify the types of answers supported:

decimal, integer, boolean, date, string, text, dateTime, instant, choice, open-choice

On the other hand, the QuestionnaireAnswers structures allows for *any* data type or resource.

The recommendation is to constrain QuestionnaireAnswers to only the types supported by Questionnaire.  However, there are a few data types not currently supported by questionnaire that probably should be:

time (a new data type where no date applies), Attachment (for complex content like images or files), and Resource(Any) (for things like Practitioner look-up, Organization look-up, Medicaiton look-up, etc.)  The remaining complex data types (human name, address, etc.) are inappropriate for core, though they might be added as extensions
It would be nice to have a property in Immunization resource for referencing ImmunizationRecommendation by which the Immunization was done.

summary: Not Equal operator in search queries
details: It would be nice to search resources by specifying "not equals" conditions in search queries. Operator != could be used. The use case might be: to search all compositions which status is not final.

summary: Contacts should have a way to record "direct addresses"
details:
http://www.hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/contact-system.html includes phone, fax, email, and url. This is a fixed list, meaning there's no way to provide other contact details without resorting to extensions.

This value set should be expanded to include "direct".

Direct (secure email for health, see http://wiki.directproject.org/) is an increasingly important part of how healthcare communications occur in the US, and it's a feature supported by every 2014-Certified EHR here.

Right now, QuestionnaireAnswers limits itself to being authored by Practitioner, Patient or RelatedPerson.  Given that Questionnaires are typically authored by humans, that seemed a reasonable list.  However, we're defining an Operation on Questionnaire to allow auto-generation of a QuestionnaireAnswers instance with partial (or maybe even full) population of the answers based on existing or specified data.  And that work would be done by software.  Therefore, I think that we should extend the list of resources to include Device.

Part of the SDC project involves defining an operation that allows auto-population of questionnaires (generating a QuestionnaireAnswers instance).  At the moment, the tooling only supports doing this at the resource level, not the profile level.  Practically, this seems like a useful feature to have in general, not just for SDC-specific purposes.  Therefore, I'd like permission to do this at the root resource level.

Composition.event matches CDA service event (the definition is the same), but in CDA the cardinality is 0..*. For some unknown reason this is 0..1 in the Composition resource - this is probably because of the past attempt to harmonise CDA and XDS in a single resource.

We should change the cardinality to 0..*, and update the definition to "A clinical service, such as a colonoscopy or an appendectomy, being documented."

it seems all kinds of resource have a  section "Search Parameters",for example,in the 5.4.5Search Parameters for Organization

the description for _language is "The stated language of the resource",I think we should make it more clearly,"search the value of the optional language element for every resource "

another suggestion about the language element ,it is said that we should use the code in the bcp47, can we just list all the possible code instead of saying you could "using the codes defined in BCP 47."

The current definition of Observation.subject is:

"The thing the observation is being made about."

I'm working with an implementer on adopting observation, and we've
found a need to define a new extension, but I think that this shows we
need a better definition on the observation.

There's 2 use cases we need to deal with:
* a fetal heartbeat - the mother is the subject, the LIONC code is
[fetal heartrate], and fetus is [fetus 2] - the last bit is the
extension
* the second case is in social medicine/psychology, where you're
talking to a patient (or, more likely, "client"), and you make an 

observation about their spouse (or other relation). 

 

Note: there's really 2 variations on this - you're taking 

a patient's history, and gather some information from 

their spouse (perhaps they're unconscious), 

or, you're counselling a patient, and make 

observations about their spouse as part of the process.

 

The first is an observation about the spouse with the 

person you're talking to as an informant. And it belongs

in the spouse's record. But the second, it's not. This

is not an observation you can put in the spouse's

record, and it's not even about them. In fact, the target

of the observation may not be identified any better than

"spouse" (or "boss", or "(hl7) colleague ;-)). The subject 

of the observation is the person you're treating/whatever.

 

So there's an extension here - kind of like body site, 

but 'remote' body site. I still need to clarify the exact 

definition of the extension, but whatever it is, I think 

this shows that a better definition of Observation.subject 

is needed. Suggested wording:


Subject: The person/device/etc. whose record this observation is
associated with and whose characteristics (direct or indirect) are
described by the observation
Comments: Indirect characteristics may be those of a specimen, fetus,
relative, etc.

invarient for obs:  ~~Invariants Defined on this element
Inv-2: Can only have normal range if value is a quantity (xpath: exists(f:valueQuantity) or not(exists(f:normalRange)))

worked when ref range was only numeric but now with text.  too restrictive.  For example for serology may want a reference range  "Not - reactive" 

Proposal to remove.

summary: Change the way version specific updates works
details:
At present, version aware updates are done this way:

In particular, servers may choose to implement version-aware updates, where the only updates that are accepted quote the current version of the resource. In this case, the client must submit the currently correct version specific URL in the Content-Location in the PUT request. If the value is missing, the server SHALL return a 412 Preconditions failed response. Clients SHOULD submit a proper Content-Location header and SHALL correctly understand a 409 response as an update conflict.

The normal way to do this in other RESTful APIs is to use etags. Early drafts of FHIR used eTags, but this was removed because of privacy concerns that had been identified. However these have not meant that eTag usage has been replaced, and the eTag approach is better - (see comments thread here: http://hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/http.html#comment-1535338227)

We should replace this content-location approach with the standard e-tag appraoch (even if it's not consistent with the OMG RLUS spec - that should change too)

I've been involved in x-vendor investigation specific metadata in an XDS transaction that is important to consumers, and one finding was that the practice setting code should always be provided if available. I propose adding this to the DocumentReference resource and constrained to use on of the terms defined in this value set: http://www.hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/valueset-xds-practice-codes.html

Encounter.Status pulls from the FHIR EncounterState list. In contrast, Appointment.Status draws from v3 ActStatus. The v3 ActStatus list is missing key concepts that are commonly used for tracking appointment statuses. e.g. Confirmed, Arrived, No Show, Left Without Being Seen. I'd recommend that we create a FHIR coded list = AppointmentState rather than rely on the v3 ActStatus list.

For generating a FHIR AppointmentState, we should look to v2 and other sources. Some examples below:

v2 User-defined Table 0278:

Pending - Appointment has not yet been confirmed
Waitlist - Appointment has been placed on a waiting list for a particular slot, or set of slots
Booked - The indicated appointment is booked
Started - The indicated appointment has begun and is currently in progress
Complete - The indicated appointment has completed normally (was not discontinued, canceled, or deleted)
Cancelled - The indicated appointment was stopped from occurring (canceled prior to starting)
Dc - The indicated appointment was discontinued (DC'ed while in progress, discontinued parent appointment, or discontinued child appointment)
Deleted - The indicated appointment was deleted from the filler application
Blocked - The indicated time slot(s) is(are) blocked
Overbook - The appointment has been confirmed; however it is confirmed in an overbooked state
Noshow - The patient did not show up for the appointment

 

HSCIC data dictionary -> Appointment -> Attended or did not attend

summary: Tool extensions should be moved to resource-specific profiles
details: There's a bunch of extensions defined in tools-extensions that apply to various resources (Profile, ValueSet, etc.)  It's extremely unlikely that anyone will find them there - they aren' treferenced from the resources.  As well, these extensions aare no more or less likely to get promoted into core than any of the other extensions we've defined.  Suggest deprecating these and migrating to equivalent extensions in the "extensions" profiles for the indeividual resources.

summary: Code Mappings table should have a border around it
details:
The table that shows the address use mapping values to v2 and v3 would benefit from having a border around it, same as the others tables on the page.

(This would also then apply to the Administrative Gender mappings page)

http://hl7-fhir.github.io/administrative-gender.html

summary: Code system OIDs aren't being exposed everywhere
details: Some value sets (perhaps just FHIR-defined code systems?) aren't showing their OIDs in the specification.

Per Skype chat, we should move to a simplified JSON representation of extensions.

 

For primitives, we should use:

 "dob": "1972-11-30",

 "_dob": { 
   "http://example.org/fhir/extensions#text": [{
      "valueString" : "Easter 1970"
   }]
 }

instead of:
 "dob": "1972-11-30",
 "_dob": { 
   "extension": [{
      "url" : "http://example.org/fhir/extensions#text",
      "valueString" : "Easter 1970"
   }]
 }

---

For grouped structures, we should use:
"name" : {
  "http://hl7.org/fhir/Profileiso-21090#name-use": [{
      "valueCode" : "I"
   }],
  "text": "Chief Red Cloud"
}

instead of:
"name" : {
  "extension: [
    {
      "url" : "http://hl7.org/fhir/Profileiso-21090#name-use",
      "valueCode" : "I"
     }]
  "text": "Chief Red Cloud"
}

summary: Add DateTime to the Attachment data type
details: Request adding a DateTime element (0..1) to the Attachment data type as this alligns this with other standards such as RDF, XMP metadata descriptions so that the timestamp of the creation of the attachment material can be conveyed if known without needing to look in the attachment itself or requiring the creation of a companion DateTime element on any resource which includes an element using the attachment data type.

summary: QuestionnaireAnswers Resource is missing from the list of Clinical Resources
details: The list of Resources that are available in the clinical context is missing the QuestionnaireAnswers Resource.

summary: QuestionnaireAnswers is missing the valueReference as child of answer
details:
QuestionnaireAnswers is missing the valueReference under the list of available answers.

Where the definition of the question can request a reference
(http://hl7-fhir.github.io/answer-format.html)

The docs for MedicationDispense.dispense say "Indicates the details of the dispense event such as the days supply" -- but then there's no field for days supply that I see.

 

This absence is conspicuous: it contradicts the documentation for MedicationDispense, as well as the design of MedicationPrescription.dispense.expectedSupplyDuration

summary: Patient's "provider" search param has the wrong element path
details: Patient's "provider" search param currently has a search path of "Patient.managingOrganization". The intended path appears to be "Patient.careProvider".

summary: Paths are missing for search params with [x] in their element name
details:
For search param definitions like:

value-quantityquantity ... Observation.value[x]

there's no actual path. The FHIR spec should say "Observation.valueCodeableConcept". The underlying XML exhibits the same issue:

<searchParam>
<name value="value-concept"/>
<type value="token"/>
<documentation value="The value of the observation, if the value is a CodeableConcept"/>
<xpath value="f:Observation/f:value[x]"/>
</searchParam>

summary: DeviceObservationReport should be searchable by instant date range
details:
I would like to get results for DeviceObservationReports between a date range. We can do this with DiagnosticReports.issued, so I assume the same functionality should apply to DeviceObservationReport.instant.

On a separate note, why are these date properties named differently: issued vs instant?

summary: Organization.active and Location.status have similar meaning but inconsistent representation in data model
details:
Location.status allows three values from a fixed code list (active, inactive, suspended)

Organization.active is boolean

It would be more consistent if Organization could use a code list as well.

Also, I have seen a few cases where a jurisdication will have a several additional status codes for a location (thinking of it as a facility).  For example, under-construction.   It would be nice if the fixed code list could be extended.  Perhaps the proper way is to make Location.status a codable concept?

For the the location  resource, it looks like there is only one allowed name to be associated to a location (when it represents a health faciltiy).   In the context I am working in, it is pretty common to permit multiple names for these resources.  This is both for giving the name of the location in multiple languages as well as to give variants within the same languamge (for Example, "Pembo HC" and "Pembo Health Clinic").   This is primarily for matching when executing a query, but this list of valid names could also be useful to expose to for consumption by other systems.

Note that in the CSD standard (and the HPD and related standards when an org unit is used to represent facilities) multiple names for a facility

For the the organization  resource, it looks like there is only one allowed name to be associated to an organization.  It is pretty common to permit multiple names for these resources.  This is both for giving the name of the organization in multiple languages as well as to give variants within the same language.   This is primarily for matching when executing a query, but this list of valid names could also be useful to expose to for consumption by other systems.

Note that in the CSD and HPD  standards multiple names for an organization are the norm.  E.g. with HPD=LDAP the commonName is allowed multiple times.

summary: Inconsistency and optionality in structure/extension name resolution causes more special cases than necessary
details:
When referencing structures and extensions (either from a Tag or profile element in TypeRef), the "anchor" part of the structure/extension url is optional.  In DSTU1 it is not clear how to resolve these references in every case, which is complicated even more by the fact that Structure.name is optional. An example is where the TypeRef.code is "ResourceReference" and the TypeRef.profile has no #anchor.  For other cases, the Structure.type has to be considered if Structure.name is missing and rules about Structure.Public further complicate type resolution.  As well, both ExtensionDefn and Structure are top-level Profile constructs that can be addressed by a url #anchor, but the element is called "code" in ExtensionDefn and "name" in Structure. Finally, while teaching I see constant confusion about the difference between a "profile" a "profile url without anchor" a "profile url with anchor" and the role of structure.name.  I propose the following:

* Rename ExtensionDefn.code to ExtensionDefn.name (to make it consistent with Structure.name)

* Make Structure.name 1..1 (to make it consistent with ExtensionDefn.name). This will remove the need for "fallback" resolution based on Structure.type

* Abolish the term "profile reference" and force "structure references" and "extension references" to always include an anchor.

summary: Human name of practitioner cannot capture all needed components for a name
details:
There are difficulties in mapping a health workers name into the FHIR model, especially if the name is stored in a structured way.  It is quite common for a country to have multiple components in a name. It would be great if this could be readily mapped into FHIR rather than through the defintion of extension points.  

Another issue is that LDAP data models are often in use (e.g. from HPD). Here the common name can be repeated multiple times.  If practitioner.name.text was 0..*, one could easily map the common name into the FHIR representaiton.   Note, in LDAP there is no "preferred" common name so there is no need to distringuish them.

summary: Practitioner address data model not rich enough to capture needed information in all countries
details:
The current address data should be enhanced to capture the structure of address in a country without having to define an extension.  Possibly the line element could be augmented with an attribute to capture the use of the line.

For example, in east Africa (e.g. Uganda, Tanzania, Zambia) there are two structure type for address being used.  One has a "plot", the other is more like (but not exactly like) the current address in FHIR.

 

On another note, in the narrative for the address data type, it referes to a "postal address."  In Uganda and Zambia (for example) a postal address is a distinct notion from a physical address, although both should be capture by the address data type.   I would suggest changing "postal address" to simply "address" in the narrative.
Specimen.collection is "1..1", but all of its sub-elements are optional. Is there any reason not to back Specimen.collection down to "0..1"?

Can an exension have a valueString *and* child extensions?

The relevant portion of the spec is:

```
The actual content of the extension consists of either a single value in the value[x] element,
or it can contain additional extensions, each with their own defining url and content

An extension SHALL have either a value (i.e. a value[x] element) or child extensions.
The value[x] element SHALL have content and/or an id attribute that is the target of
a reference from the Narrative
```

... I assume I can have both, but if that's the case, how would such a definition be rendered (e.g. at http://hl7-fhir.github.io/familyhistory-genetics-pedigree.html)?


[11:21:23 AM] Lloyd McKenzie: I don't *think* it makes sense to extend extension if you've got a value.  You can extend the value[x] element
[11:22:28 AM] Paul Knapp: and structurally I read the text to say you cannot have both though that may not be the intention
[11:23:03 AM] Josh Mandel: Fascinating -- that's a third option I hadn't considered. So when I want to represent an extension with two fields in it, I can do:

extension:
  extension a
  extension b

extension:
  value a
  extension b

extension:
  value a:
    extension b
[11:25:07 AM] Paul Knapp: but only the first is two children. I see that there are two additional elements in the aggregate but I don't think #2 is valid according to the language though 1 and 3 are. #1 to me says 2 children, #3 say child and grandchild.
[11:26:16 AM] Paul Knapp: actually #3 is a child with issues
[11:26:18 AM] Josh Mandel: Paul, when I think about it though, #2 has to be valid. I mean if 

extension:
  value a

 is valid unto itself, and extensions are extensible... then surely I can add "extension b" to it without breaking it (or even changing its meaning)?
[11:27:21 AM] Paul Knapp: you can add an extension to the value a, but not to the extension given the 'you can have either a value or an extension' text above
[11:27:50 AM] Paul Knapp: so #3 follows that pattern
[11:29:24 AM] Paul Knapp: so this goes to your initial question Josh, as in can you have a value and an, or more than one, extension on the same extension
[11:29:45 AM] Josh Mandel: Exactly. FWIW, current parsers and serializers accept #2 :-)
[11:31:28 AM] Paul Knapp: I think the 'you can't have both' text is at odds with the use of extensions eslewher and that implementations have applied extensions consistently hence they allow #2.
[11:31:47 AM] Lloyd McKenzie: Extensions on extension are intended to define complex extensions.  You can't have a complex extension and a value
[11:32:25 AM] Josh Mandel: Okay. I ran across this "in the wild", which is why I brought it up here.
[11:33:04 AM] Paul Knapp: If we aren't going to allow extensions to contain multiple children, and I'm questioning why we don't - maybe we should discuss in Chicago, then your #2 would be my choice for a fallback.
[11:33:50 AM] Lloyd McKenzie: Extensions can contain either a single value or multiple extensions
[11:34:11 AM] Paul Knapp: @Lloyd, so why don't we say 'if you want to define a complex extension you can't have a value.
[11:34:20 AM] Lloyd McKenzie: We should
[11:35:27 AM] Paul Knapp: Correction to my above I meant #1 NOT #2
[11:35:52 AM] Lloyd McKenzie: #1 and #3 are both valid
[11:36:52 AM] Paul Knapp: and to my point on the FMG call Wednesday, you can't have multiple values on an extension as we see above. You simulate multiple values with multiple extensions.
[11:36:56 AM] James Agnew: The spec doesn’t look ambiguous to me?
[11:37:00 AM] James Agnew: “An extension SHALL have either a value (i.e. a value[x] element) or child extensions.”
[11:37:17 AM] James Agnew: You can have a value, OR you can have child extensions
[11:39:23 AM] James Agnew: I guess it’s less clear on whether you should be allowed to extend an extension value, but my goodness would that be confusing. That shouldn’t be ok
[11:45:44 AM] Paul Knapp: While I agree you can quickly build a complex 3D mess, its clear to me that that is both allowed and intended. Especially usefull if that is what you need to convey :(
[11:52:58 AM] James Agnew: I would think that if you have the need to convey in an extension “a string and an extension to that string” you could just define an extension with those two values as “root elements”
[11:53:32 AM] James Agnew: ..also i’d say it appears to be allowed, but is it intended? There certainly aren’t any examples I’ve come across that do that...
[12:08:00 PM] Josh Mandel: @James I actually found the language ambigiuous. For me ", but not both" would certainly clinch it.
[12:08:20 PM] Lloyd McKenzie: Change request away :)
[12:08:29 PM] Josh Mandel: I shall, if that's the intended meaning.
[12:08:40 PM] Josh Mandel: Given that parsers, etc allow it though, I wasn't sure.
[12:08:57 PM] Lloyd McKenzie: There should be a schematron constraint . . .
[12:13:20 PM] Josh Mandel: @Lloyd: not sure about schematron, but Java and Pascal accept it, anyway.
Currently Observation.value[x] doesn't permit a boolean value. I can't see any reason why -- is this just an oversight?

summary: Bundle terms shouldn't only be defined in xml.html
details:
Regarding entry.id in bundles, I asked the difference between entry.id and entry.link[rel=self], and Grahame said "entry.id is required, and represents version-independent URL, and entry.link[rel=self] is optional, and should convey version-specific URL". I couldn't find this in the spec anywhere, but I realized it's in http://hl7.org/implement/Standards/fhir/xml.html -- which makes it totally invisible for people working with JSON.

Possible fixes:

 * describe these constraints in some common place (extras.html? a new bundles.html?)

details: In the nightly build version of the valuesets download, the <link> references in v3-codesystems.xml have been changed to (nonstandard) backslashes. They should be changed back to forward slashes to conform to common usage.

summary: Extensibility page has incorrect example for modifier, and has xml-specific language
details:
Under 1.12.6.0.2 there's an incorrect example of "url" on a modifier extension:

<AllergyIntolerance> <modifierExtension> <url value="http://example.org/fhir/extensions#certainty" /> <valueCoding> <system value="http://example.org/codes/certainty"/>

---

 

Also, under 1.12.6.0.1 Extension Element, the following text:

"The extension elements appear as the first set of children, prior to any other defined child elements."

applies only to XML representation. It should be designated as such (or documented in xml.html).

Resource Alert currently only supports a text attribute to record the meaning of the alert (Alert.note), and has its cardinality 1..1. In our use case, we have a well defined coded value set to represent the meaning of alert, and use the text attribute to capture optional further information like description or comment. Two changes are proposed:

1. Change the cardinality of Alert.note to 0..1 so that it is optional

2. Add a new attribute Alert.code (CodeableConcept) so that application can choose a coded representation of the alert if they have a defined value set.

summary: In Conformance, Operations can be defined on "Rest" level, not on resource level
details:
In Conformance, Rest.operation is a list of supported operations (including searches and the "standard" searches). Each of these operations define (within the OPerationDefinition resource) on which resources this operation is valid. How do I specify that my implementation supports this operation on only a specific subset of these resources? Do I have to create a new OperationDefinition?

If Resource in Conformance would also have a relationship to OperationDefinition, would that be an enhancement to indicate that I only support this operation on specific resources?

summary: The way discriminators work on slices precludes slicing on extensions/elements within ResourceReference
details:
When the sliced element is a ResourceReference, the discriminator indicates an element within the referenced resource rather than within the ResourceReference datatype.

This precludes slicing on elements or extensions within the ResourceReference, so for example a profile cannot slice on the value of "performerType" in Observation data like:

"performer": {

  "extension": {

    url: "http://my-vocab/performerType",

    valueString: "assistant performer"

  }

  "reference": "/Practitioner/123"

}

summary: FHIR does not have defaults, but certainly for "boolean" elements, we are assuming defaults in many places
details: In many places, we have optional booleans where the author assumes the default is "false", even if FHIR has no notion of default. What's worse, in many places it's really unclear what it means for the boolean to be missing. What's the right method to proceed and correct these cases?

The definition for Attachment.hash (at http://hl7-fhir.github.io/datatypes-definitions.html#Attachment.hash) states that the value should be the "The calculated hash of the data using SHA-1. Represented using base64."

Given that SHA-1 is being broadly deprecated, would it not make sense to rather require a SHA-2 hash (e.g. SHA-256, SHA-384, or SHA-512) ?
Profile displays aren't showing "must support" or binding.conformance and binding.isExtensible

summary: Need a formal support mechanism for i18n and l10n of schemas and schematrons
details:
For non-english communities,  there is a need for a formal support mechanism for i18n and l10n of schemas and schematrons. For example, how to translate the names and annotations in these artefacts in a specified language other than English?  The following snippet shows what/how I am doing:

 

--<xs:complexType name="Element">
----<xs:annotation>
------<xs:documentation>元素：用于表示所有FHIR元素和资源的基础元素——允许利用扩展对它们加以扩展。</xs:documentation>
------<xs:documentation>The base element used for all FHIR elements and resources - allows for them to be extended with extensions</xs:documentation>
----</xs:annotation>

 

In order to display the translation (not the original English annotations) in a XML editor,  the translations are placed ahead of their English counterparts. And a translation is structured as non-english name and/or synonyms followed by a definition/description and free-text constrains.

summary: Addition of version field to ValueSet.expansion.contains
details:
The current definition of ValueSet does not include the version of the code system (as optionally stated in ValueSet.define.version in ValueSet.expansion.contains when the value set is expanded.

One issue with this approach is that it does not support code systems (terminologies) in which concept identifiers (the concept codes) may be reused (i.e. concept permanence is not supported). In this situation, version matters and the expansion will not be able to reliably return both codes.

This proposal suggests adding version as an optional field to ValueSet.expansion.contains. When the value set is expanded, ValueSet.expansion.contains.version will be populated with the value of the corresponding ValueSet.define.version (if present).

In terms of broader support, I have done some research and found the following specifications which all support returning the version of the code system in expansion of value sets:

1. OMG CTS2 1.1:

http://www.omg.org/spec/cts2/130601/valuesetdefinition/ValueSetDefinition.xsd (see section on ResolvedValueSet)

2. IHE Sharing Value Sets (SVS)

http://www.ihe.net/Technical_Framework/upload/IHE_ITI_Suppl_SVS_Rev2-1_TI_2010-08-10.pdf (see section 3.48.4.2.2)

3. CSIRO OntoServer API 

http://ontoserver.csiro.au:8080/ontoserver/docs/ns0_valueSetInfoBean.html
