summary: Need an extension for Mother's Maiden Name
details: Mother's maiden name is a common field to collect and exchange. Since it's not in the base patient resource (agree with that decision), it needs to be defined as an extension, and should be done as part of the common patient extensions (which doesn't, as of the time of this task, exist, so it needs to be created)

summary: DocumentReference use of class and type need better alignment with IHE XDS
details: type and class need to align better with the newly clarified types in XDS. Most of the metadata definitions are better now after the XDS re-Documentation effort, so these definitions should be brought here for better alignment.

The current name is not sufficiently intuitive for its intended uses.  In discussion with SD, have landed on the name Basic.  As well, need to generalize some of the introductory text.  We also need to update all references to Other to instead refer to Basic.

Confidentiality is required - because of CDA usage-  but many kinds of documents, including documents that the publishing tools are now producing, confidentiality is simply not relevant. This should be optional, and clinical document profiles can make it required

summary: Open up the subject type for Composition,subject
details:
At present, Composition only allows a limited number of choices for the subject of the composition - ones such as Patient etc that are suitable for clinical documents. The publishing tools are now using composition for implementation related artifacts such as Profile and ExtensionDefinition, and this isn't obviously any particular kind of resource other then Basic

So we should open Composition.subject to be any, and it can be narrowed in clinical document profiles etc.

summary: Profile intro and notes sections got lost in redesign
Adjust note about UTF-8 in API page
details:
Curently, the API says:

FHIR uses UTF-8 for all request and response bodies. Since the HTTP specification (section 3.7.1) defines a default character encoding of ISO-8859-1, requests and responses SHALL explicitly set the character encoding to UTF-8 using the 'charset' parameter of the MIME-type in the Content-Type header. Requests MAY also specify this charset parameter in the Accept header and/or use the Accept-Charset header.

but this doesn't make sense, because (a) we define the mime types and (b) we don't define them to have a character set. Instead of this, we should be explicit, and say that the two mime types we define are always UTF-8, and in this section, we can say that since these mime types are always UTF-8, the HTTP default does not apply.

summary: Allow defining Queries / Operation Definitions at the Conformance.resource level
details:
Advanced / named queries can currently only  be defined at the Conformance.rest level.

The examples in the FHIR Documentation related to advanced queries have resource specific queries:
GET [base-url]/Patient?_query=name¶meters...
GET [service-url]/ValueSet/?_query=expand&id=:valueSet&...

I also implemented a named query, which again is resource specific This cannot be properly documented in the Conformance. Lloyd pointed out that in DSTU 2 query is replaced by OperationDefinition, which is again only defined at the Conformance.rest level.

My change request is to also allow queries to be defined at the Conformance.rest.resource level, so that resource specific named queries can be properly documented, and people cab find them in the place where they belong.

For both Encounter.indication and Encounter.hospitalization.dischargeDiagnosis, you've got Reference(Any).  There's no reason to be this open.  It's going to result in inconsistency.  For discharge diagnosis, I don't think anything other than Observation and Condition makes sense and you ought to be able to limit to Condition.  For indication, Condition, Observation are all that really make sense either.  If you have a ReferralRequest, ProcedureRequest or DiagnosticRequest, those should be linked in "fulfils", not "indication".

As well, look at taking "reason" and "indication" and combining them into a choice unless you have strong use-cases for supporting both.

summary: Descriptive text elements in differential profiles need to be able to say "append"
details: For elements like requirements, usage notes, aliases, etc., there are times when you want to overwrite what's in the base profile/resource, but there are other times when you just want to add an extra paragraph or a few extra names.  It would be helpful if there was a convention that would allow you to say "please append the following to whatever's in the base".  E.g. If you start with "...", that would mean that in the snapshot, the "..." would be replaced with the text from the base.

It's quite useful to be able to perform multiple code translations (and multiple validation steps) as part of a single call.  The simplest level of this would be to use a single ValueSet or ConceptMap and multiple codes/Codings/CodeableConcepts.  Ideally, you'd be able to pass in multiple pairs.  E.g. "Validate Coding 1 against ValueSet 1; Coding 2 against ValueSet 2; etc.".  For performance reasons, it may be adventageous to validate all of those with a single call rather than a whole bunch of separate calls.

details: When a search parameter is defined to search trough an element that is of a complex datatype, it is unclear what this means. summary: Clarify binding definitions for codes and/or text
details:
Binding Definitions

Current text says:

"isExtensible indicates whether additional codes are allowed beyond those in the defined set of codes."

I suggest this be amended to say:
"isExtensible indicates whether additional codes and/or plain text are allowed beyond those in the defined set of codes."
That would be more consistent with the definition given below, where it says that text, not just additional codes, may be necessary.

summary: Confusing description of internal references to extensions
details:
Change proposal is to clarify the wording in this section.

I didn't understand the following statement, which appears to be self-contradictory.
"When an extension is the target of an internal reference, the reference is always to the value of the extension. An extension is only allowed to be the target of a reference when it has no value[x]"

The first part says the reference is always to "the value of the extension." But then the second sentence says an extension is only allowed to be the target of a reference when it has no value[x]" If an extension has no value[x], then how can there be a reference to that (nonexistent) value? Lloyd replied to my question saying "I agree this wording is confusing. I think it's intended to say "content" rather than "value". Can you submit a change request for us to improve the description."

summary: Resource package/profile list should link directly to profile if only one is defined for unique id
details:
There has been a recent change to profile list from a given resource to allow for a group of profiles which is reasonable.

However, for the simple case where one name/id maps to a single profile the profile group page should be skipped and the resource package (profile) linked directly to the detailed profile page. Isn't very useful for a user to jump to a page with only a single link to another page with the content they want. Users hate unnecessary mouse  clicks to get to where they want to go to.

Navigation Example:

Starting at http://hl7-fhir.github.io/condition-packages.html

Would expect clicking on “Clinical Quality Framework (CQF) Condition Refuted Profile” would take me to the refuted profile page not the new grouped page (i.e. cqf-condition.html) so the target link here should rather be to http://hl7-fhir.github.io/cqf-condition-refuted-cqf-condition-refuted.html

Having only a single profile with a unique name/id would be the typical case and having a group of profiles with the same logical name will probably be the exception so the desired navigation can be optimized to jump to a group page only with a group exists and the profile if no group exists.

summary: Use of Act.status as a vocabulary is discouraged
details: In general, FHIR resources should have statuses that are specific to the type of resource and make use of common business terms.  They need not have clean mappings to ActStatus.  (E.g. Observation.status includes the notion of "revised" which doesn't correspond to an Act.status).  Referring to the generic act statuses is unlikely to be clear to implementers.  (Feel free to include mappings to the ActStatus code system if you wish.)

summary: Diagnostic Report - consider adding reference to encounter
details: Please consider adding encounter to the core DiagnosticReport resource.
Consider adding a reference(encounter) in the immunization resource.

I recently ran into problems representing certain medication frequencies in the current FHIR Timing structure.  Specifically, frequencies that have both a duration and a width (“Every 21 days for 1 hour”, which is used in chemo infusions) or that have a range (“Every 4-6 hours”) can’t be represented in the current FHIR Timing.repeat structure.  I would like to propose the following revisions to Timing.repeat to address these issues:

• Add “periodWidth” (decimal)

• Rename “units” to be “periodUnit”

• Add “durationUnit” (UCUM code, as with periodUnits)

• Add “rangeMax” (decimal).  Definition: “the maximum value for a range that when present and non-zero would represent the inclusive upper bound where the inclusive lower-bound would be either the frequency or the periodWidth”, whichever was not 1.

• Add a rule that either frequency or periodWidth must be 1

Using these attributes with the existing frequency and duration attributes, you would be able to represent some common frequencies as follows:

(F=frequency, W=periodWidth, U=periodUnit, M=rangeMax, D=duration, DU=durationUnit)

• Every 8 hours:                                        F:1,W:8,U:h

• Every 7 days                                            F:1,W:7,U:d

• 3 times a day                                           F:3,W:1,U:d

• Every 4-6 hours                                      F:1,W:4,U:h,M:6

• Every 21 days for 1 hour                     F:1,W:21,U:d,D:1,DU:h

• Three times a week for ½ hour       F:3,W: 1,U:wk,D:0.5,DU:h

Another change I would prefer, but which is not necessary to fix this problem is to change "frequency" to "period".  I think this would be more intuitive for implementers.

summary: Add Frame Number Reference in ImagingObjectSelection resource
details:
The ImagingObjectSelection resource (draft resource proposed to DSTU 2) lacks frame number reference at the instance level. A DICOM imaging SOP instance may be a multi-frame image, and one should explicitly specify the frame number(s) which are referenced in the selection. A multi-frame image may contain several thounds frames. Without frame number reference, the selection can be useless.

Proposal:

Add a component imageFrame within instance component, the cardinality is 0..x. This component is required if the referenced image SOP instance is a multi-frame image.

The imageFrame component has one element frameNumber, the type is int and value cardinality is 1..1 (if the imageFrame component exist, its frameFrame element must be populated.

summary: Add Presentation State SOP Instance Reference in ImageObjectSelection
details:
The proposed ImagingObjectSelection resource (DSTU 2) is designed to convey the content of the DICOM Key Object Selection (KOS) SOP Class in a FHIR resource becasue the KOS object is widely used to exchange of a set of imaging object with other healthcare systems like EMR. In the DICOM KOS specification, each referenced imaging SOP instance may include a reference to one presentation state object to assist the receiver of the KOS object to render the image (frames) in a way that the sender desired to present. The current draft of the resource does not include this element.

Proposal:

Add a presentationState component with the instance component, its value cardinality is 0..1

The presentationState component contains the following two elements:

presentationState.sopClass, type: oid, cardinality 1..1

presentationState.uid, type oid, cardinality 1..1

Invariants are being repeated.  (Also need to figure out what to do about invariant ids - is it ok if a profile defines an invariant with the same id as the parent, or is it expected that would be a redefine of the existing invariant to make it tigher - or is that even legal?)

summary: XHTML template files should be valid XHTML
details:
All of the XHTML templates have special strings embedded for string substitution.  We should define those special strings in such a manner that they're still valid XHTML.  Specifically:

doctype should refer to lower-case xhtml

[%settitle Clinical Resources%] should be <!--[%settitle Clinical Resources%]-->

[%file newheader%] should be <title>[%file newheader%]</title>

<script> elements should include the "type" attribute

May be worth exploring whether we can do something with resItem and other elements as well

(For after Draft For Comment opens)

Where the name consists of multiple words, sometimes we have the style "duetocode", sometimes "due-to-code" and in at least some cases "dueto-code".  We should have a consistent naming style for search criteria.  Recommended standard is to only combine words if they're a compound word recognized in US dictionaries (i.e. MS Word doesn't choke).  Otherwise, split using a dash.

summary: Please document the preferred methods for extending operations for local use by a specific implementation
details:
I was specifically looking at how to extend the translate operation on concept maps.

In our use, we have found that with Legacy system integration, sometimes we need to obtain the display text for the source coding system/value as it was not present in the original system. We have parameters that tell the terminology server to include source text parameter updates in the return as well. I suppose this case is not part of the 80% rule for FHIR. Thus I believe we could just implement it by extending the Translate operation to include this parameter.

summary: Add Batch mode for translate functions
details:
I have been reviewing the Terminology additions proposed for DSTU 2. Specifically I have been looking at http://hl7-fhir.github.io/conceptmap-operations.html#translate.

We have a use case with the US DoD and VA where we receive a lot of codings in the US DoD and VA local codes in their legacy repositories. We have to bulk translate these to national standards. We augmented the Terminology Server in use at these facilities to include a bulk translation mechanism that allows us to pass a series of pairs where you specify the source systems, code and value to translate and the destination coding system to translate to. The function returns an array of the pairs with the translated data.

We did this because the terminology server is in a different network location than our proposed clinical FHIR server endpoints to legacy systems and we wanted to remove the network latency of all those translate calls.

Is there any thought to adding a batch processing capability to translate? This does not seem to be covered by extension methods on operations as the original translate parameters won't apply.

From Lloyd...

We just added a batch mode validation operation.  A batch mode translation operation would be reasonable too.  Would you want to do it against a single concept map or would you specify a separate concept map per coding?  In any event, submit a change request.

Answer:

We implemented a general purpose set of parameters that would allow you to specify different coding system targets for each code you want to translate. Therefore, we would like to be able to specify the code system to translate to for each source system coding in the batch.

Here is an example of the payload request for the system we implemented (and forgive the use of OIDs in the example)...

Request:

<mapConceptCodeRequests>

<sourceCodeSystemId>2.16.840.1.113883.3.232.99.5</sourceCodeSystemId>

<targetCodeSystemId>2.16.840.1.113883.3.232.99.6</targetCodeSystemId>

          </mapConceptCodeRequest> 
               <mapConceptCodeRequest>

                    <designationType>3</designationType> 
          </mapConceptCodeRequest> 
     </mapConceptCodeRequests>

 

Response:

<mapConceptCodeResultSets>

I would not expact FHIR's to look like this, I just included it for clarity of what we did.

summary: Need to define behavior around ignoring updates
details: In FHIR, it is *legal* to send an update to a server and have some portions of those updates ignored.  E.g. If I send a patient with one name and you have 3 names, you're not required to get rid of your extra names.  This is normal practice in the v2 messaging space.  However, in v2, there's the ability to use "null" to explicitly remove a particular occurrence.  In FHIR, we have no equivalent mechanism to control this.  As well, while this behavior is common in messaging, it's going to be more surprising in the RESTful space.  We need to define *exactly* what expectations client systems should have and what the appropriate mechanisms are to have control over what happens on the server.

To refer to an extensiondefinition, a profile places the url of the ExtensionDefinintion in the Profile.x.element.type.profile element. 

Suggest enhancing the documentation to make this clear.

The syntax of the rules needs to be clarified. As it currently reads:

GET [base]/[type]?[parameters] {&_format=[mime-type]}

It looks like ? and parameters are required, which isn't the case if you're searching for all the instances of a resource (eg: GET [base]/Patient).

If [] denotes required and {} optional, it should read
GET [base]/[type]{?[parameters]}{&_format=[mime-type]}

The same goes for other REST rules listed.

summary: ElementDefinition.path doesn't explain how to populate it for ExtensionDefinition.element
details:
Docs for ElementDefinition.path say:

> The path identifies the element and is expressed as a "."-separated list of ancestor elements, beginning with the name of the resource or extension.

But the examples are like:
<path value="Extension"/>

If I understand correctly, the quoted text above should instead read something like:

> The path identifies the element and is expressed as a "."-separated  list of ancestor elements, relative to the named resource root in the case of elements defined in Profiles (e.g. "Patient.birthDate") or relative to the extension root in the case of elements defined in ExtensionDefinition (e.g. "Extension" for a simple extension, or "Extension.somePartName" for an extension with multiple parts).

summary: changing Specimen.source to simple element with card 0..*
details:
Grahame found this and I agree that the cardinality for  both Specimen.source AND Specimen.source.target should not both be 0..*.   To me that would imply you could have a pooled specimen of pooled specimens.  Not very likely. 
Also .source defines the relationship (parent).   So .source.relationship makes no sense which means we could make .source a simple element. 

Propose changing Specimen.source to simple element with card 0..*
Does Device include supplies such as dressings, bandages and similar substances?

summary: Check for trailing ? before appending a
details: E.g. "Are there form rendering mechanisms where it would be unreasonable to require systems to support this extension?."

summary: Json rendering of modifierExtensions is unclear
details: This section shows how normal extensions are rendered in json, but does not talk about modifierExtensions, which are serialized inside a special "modifier" property. That's worth mentioning here.

summary: Invariant constraints Inv-4 on Condition is invalid
details:
Section 4.2.2.2: Condition constraint Inv-4 is defined as following:

Inv-4: On Condition.dueTo: Relationship SHALL have either a code or a target (xpath on f:Condition/f:dueTo: exists(f:code) != exists(f:target))

Note that at some point the "code" field in dueTo and occurredFollowing may have been renamed from code to codeableConcept so this xpath expression exists(f:code) will always be false.

The other CodeableConcept fields in Condition structure (i.e. Condition, Evidence and Location) all use the element name "code" while dueTo and occurredFollowing use the element name codeableConcept .

Recommend to name the element names consistently and rename following names:

* Condition.dueTo.codeableConcept => Condition.dueTo.code

* Condition.occurredFollowing.codeableConcept => Condition.occurredFollowing.code

Otherwise need to update the xpath invariant to the correct naming.

summary: Observation invariant constraints Inv-4 is invalid
details:
This invariant is correct but has the wrong context so it can never evaluate to true.

    <sch:rule context="/f:Observation/f:dataAbsentReason">
      <sch:assert test="not(exists(f:dataAbsentReason) and exists(*[starts-with(local-name(.), 'value')]))">Inv-4: Shall only be present if Observation.value[x] is not present</sch:assert>
    </sch:rule>

The attached observation example does NOT trigger any of the Schematron rules, but it should break this constraint.

valuexxx and dataAbsentReason are elements of Observation and the context must be the top-level element f:Observation.

Must be changed to following:

    <sch:rule context="/f:Observation">
      <sch:assert test="not(exists(f:dataAbsentReason) and exists(*[starts-with(local-name(.), 'value')]))">Inv-4: Shall only be present if Observation.value[x] is not present</sch:assert>
    </sch:rule>

At present, the snapshot view doesn't highlight what cardinalities have changed.  As well, the differential view isn't actually showing what's "different", only what's included in the spreadsheet.  In the spreadsheet, it's often useful to include the data type and sometimes other information for context for the editor, even though that information hasn't changed.

The differential view *should* show cardinality, data type and short name for all elements that have any modifications, but should higlight (e.g. using bold) those whose content is different.  As well, the fly-overs for the elements should still provide the definition for those elements.

Finally, the summary of changes at the top should be removed.  It's not necessary and is too verbose.

summary: Add new elements to Goal resource to support tracking against goals and goal relationships
details:
The new Goal resourse description should be extended to include ', related objective(s) of care and progress in relation to objective(s) of care'.

After <concern> we need

relatedGoals cardinality 0..* Reference(Goal)

to cater for situations where Goals are related (cannot persue one Goal without regard to another Goal) or where Goals may be broken down into intermediate sub-Goals.

After <relatedGoals> we need

goalRecord cardinality 0..*

        type cardinality 1..1 Code  ('target' | 'measured')

        value cardinality 1..1 Reference (Observation | Procedure | ClinicalAssessment | MedicationAdministration | Encounter | Appointment | Supply)

to suport the linkage of recording of Goal related items to Goal. goalRecords would enable automated evaluation of achievement of the Goal ('target' compared to 'measurement')

summary: Add activityRecord to enable linkage of recorded activity to the CarePlan
details:
In Resource CarePlan, activity, simple

After <details> add

activityRecord cardinality 0..* Resource(Observation | Procedure | ClinicalAssessment)

to support the linkage of any record of activity where that activity is recorded in relation to the Care Plan.

summary: Need a way to profile a profile
details:
Enhancement request: There should be a way to profile a profile.

Background: Currently, only core resources can be profiled. That means that profiles cannot build on one another, for example, by incorporating extensions already defined by an existing profile, and adding another extension in addition to the existing ones. The only way to do this at the present time is to bulk-copy a profile and modify it. However, the bulk copying method doesn't allow changes to the first profile propagate to the derived profile, in the same way that (currently) changes to a base resource affect a profile of that resource.

Use cases: (1) Clinical Quality Framework (CQF) wants to adopt all the extensions and terminology bindings defined by Data Access Framework (DAF), and stay in synch with DAF as DAF changes in the future. However, DAF is quite extensive and it would be a maintenance headache to essentially create a fork by bulk-copying the DAF profiles to use as the basis for CQF profiles.  (2) Users of CQF may add their own extensions to the CQF profiles. It would be a headache to have to copy the CQF profile and modify the copy, rather than simply profiling the existing CQF profile.

Suggested change: Extend the tooling to allow a profile to give the name of a profile (not just the name of a resource) as its basis.

There are implicit rules at play when it comes to determining the types of elements. A profile specifies a resource (e.g. alert.profile.json) unless it is a type (e.g. base64Binary.profile.json) or a sub-profile (e.g. Age.profile.json). The latter two both define "base", so you know it's something other than a Resource, while the first doesn't and is thus inferred to be a resource.

Inline-defined backbone elements on the other hand do not specify a base or type either, but are assumed to be elements, not full resources (e.g. Alert.meta). Types, like base64Binary, however still do specify their type as "code: Element".

Granted those are not difficult to grasp, but would it make sense to be explicit and always specify "base" at the profile's root and/or "type [ code: Resource]", unless the element is an Element?

The Definition for MessageHeader.event states that Events defined as part of the FHIR specification have the system value "http://hl7.org/fhir/message-type".

However, the binding specifies a different valueset system value, namely "http://hl7.org/fhir/message-events".

That seems inconsistent.

The mapping entries within the Profile's elements are duplicated in the XML and JSON profiles. For example in "alert.profile.json" the mapping for "Alert" reads:

"mapping": [
  {
    "identity": "rim",
    "map": "Observation[classCode=ISSUE, moodCode=EVN]"
  },
  {
    "identity": "rim",
    "map": "Observation[classCode=ISSUE, moodCode=EVN]"
  }
]

This is the case in all profiles (that I've taken a look at).

I made a CP previous to ask change the cardinality of Alter.note from 1..1 to 0..1, so that an application uses a coded concept (extension) to capture the alert is not forced to fill in the note element.

Capturing alter in code is much desired than capturing it in text (which certainly has a good value too). But if we change the type of Alert.note from string to CodeableConcept, it will satisfy the both use cases and flexible enough to drive the use towards code wherever and whenever possible. Applications which can not support narrative alter can fill in CodeableConcept.text, and applications supporting coded alert can use CodeableConcept.coding. Since the cardinality of this element is 1..1, either text or code or both will be reinforced.

summary: Addition of additional fields to MedicationStatement resource
details:
Hello

This item is to suggest addition of the following optional fields to the core MedicationStatement resource:

1. MedicationStatement.reasonForUse (String | Codeable Concept | Condition) - this would describe why the medication is being taken and may be coded.

2. MedicationStatement.instructions (String): this would describe the instructions the patient follows for taking the medication. Note, this may be provided separate and/or additional information to what is contained in the MedicationStatement.dosage fields.

3. MedicationStatement.notes (String): this would allow the author of a MedicationStatement to adding supporting free text related to the statement.

Justification:

Inclusion of these fields would lead to a more broadly useful Medication Statement resource and promote better reuse of data and analytics (in particular a coded reasonForUse). Further, many existing Medication List applications and clinical documents use some or all of these fields. Here are a few examples from existing consumer and provider applications.

1. Medication Statements in existing consumer applications:

Fields such as these are broadly supported by a number of online and mobile consumer medication lists applications. For example:

a) Drugs.com (http://www.drugs.com) supports a For (reasonForUse) field which may be coded to include a condition. When a coded For value is chosen, this information is then reused by the system to populate the set of Conditions for the patient. Further a Comments (notes) field allows a consumer to provide additional notes. A number of screenshots attached demonstrate this functionality. 

b) The NPS MedicineWise consumer medications list smartphone application (https://itunes.apple.com/au/app/medicinelist+/id777483494?mt=8) allows consumers to maintain a medications list on their Apple iOS or Android smartphone - see attached screenshots. When adding medications, the user may enter a Condition (reasonForUse), and may also enter a Note (notes) for each medication.

c) The Australian National Health Record (the Personally Controlled Electronic Health Record or PCEHR) allows consumers to create and associate with their record a Consumer Entered Health Summary clinical document (see: https://www.nehta.gov.au/implementation-resources/clinical-documents/personal-health-summary) . The content of this document is fundamentally two lists - a Medication list and an Adverse Reaction list. Amongst the fields associated with each medication in the medication list are Directions (instructions), Clinical Indication (reasonForUse), and Comments (notes). See attached information model screenshot.

2. Medication Statements in existing clinical applications:

Medication Statements contained in Medication Lists created by clinicians frequently contain these fields as well. The following examples are from Australian national clinical document specifications and are used in the PCEHR.

a) Discharge Summary (https://www.nehta.gov.au/implementation-resources/clinical-documents/discharge-summary)

The Discharge Summary specification contains two lists of medications - one for Current Medications on Discharge and another for Ceased Medications - see attached information model screenshot. The Current Medications on Discharge list contains medications with fields for Reason for Therapeutic Good (reasonForUse), Additional Comments (note), and Dose Instruction (instructionsForUse). 

b) Shared Health Summary (https://www.nehta.gov.au/implementation-resources/clinical-documents/EP-1752-2014)

The Shared Health Summary specification defines a clinician authored health summary for an individual to be shared in the national health record. Amongst the fields in the Shared Health Summary is a list of Known Medications - see attached information model screenshot. For each Known Medication, fields exist for Directions (instructions), Clinical Indication (reasonForUse), and Comment (notes).

Thank you,

Reuben

summary: extension content model example change request
details:
In section 1.12.6.0.1 Extension Element, the provided extension content model example (pasted below) is not very clear.The way [name] be listed implies that an extension name can be assigned by user while it only allows two fixed names "extension" or "modifierExtension". To make it more clear to read, please see the suggested change.

Current version:
<[name] xmlns="http://hl7.org/fhir" url="identifies the meaning of the extension (uri)">

<value[x]></value[x]>

Suggested version:
<extension|modifierExtension xmlns="http://hl7.org/fhir" url="identifies the meaning of the extension (uri)">

<value[x]></value[x]>
</extension>

details:

summary: Operations for the Resource Resource are not shown in the list of Operation under Implementation
details: In section 2.2.0 a list of known "core" operations is shown. These do, however, not include the operations as defined for Resource (http://hl7.org/implement/standards/FHIR-Develop/resource-operations.html). Please, add these resouces to the full list of known operations.

summary: Element and type for identifier of Conformance Resources are inconsistent
details:
Most Conformance Resources have an element for their canonical identification, e.g. the "base" FHIR url where they can be found or a urn. This identification is used to reference these resources from other (conformance) resources, However, the name and type of these elements is inconsistent, making handling them more troublesome than necessary:

// Profile: url (uri)
// ExtensionDefinition: url (uri)
// SearchParameter: url (uri)
// OperationDefinition: identifier (uri)
// ValueSet: identifier (uri)
// ConceptMap: identifier (string)
// Conformance: identifier (string)
// NamingSystem: ??

Note that there's currently no way to refer to a NamingSystem resource in a canonical way.

It seems that the type of all these elements should be URI (thus avoiding ambiguity on how to represent oids/uuids in a string). I would also like all these elements to be called "identifier".

 

See this gist for a full comparison

Provenance.agent.reference is 1..1, but there's circumstances where the identity of the agent might not be known - you might just type and code, or display, or maybe some extension that identifies the agent relatively (e.g. "patient's mother". 

Reference should be optional

summary: profile.html points to constraints on elements like f:searchParam that don't exist?
details: http://hl7-fhir.github.io/profile expresses constraints on elements like f:searchParam that don't exist

summary: Search parameters are incorrectly named in conformance-base example
details:
It's a mistake that http://hl7-fhir.github.io/conformance-base.json refers to search params with "#" and dots in the name, like
   "http://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/Alert#Alert.patient"

whereas http://hl7-fhir.github.io/search-parameters.json refers to search params with no "#" and with dashes, like:
   "http://hl7.org/fhir/SearchParameter/alert-patient"

 

The latter is correct.

summary: SearcParameter.target is never populated (and should be)
details: http://hl7-fhir.github.io/search-parameters.json shows that SearchParamter.target is never populated. It should be.

The following standard extension definitions have a .value in the context path

questionnaire-sdc-additionalGroupText

questionnaire-sdc-additionalQuestionText
When an extensionDef can be applied to any resource, the .context property is set to '*' or 'any' in the standard extensionDefs. Suggest we pick one of them for consistency...

summary: Support multiple referrals on a professional claim
details:
In looking at the professional claim resource [1], it appears that there can only be one referral.  However, the US EDI 5010 837-P supports multiple referrals.

2310A — REFERRING PROVIDER NAME Loop Repeat: 2

When there is only one referral on the claim, use code “DN - Referring Provider”. When more than one referral exists and there is a requirement to report the additional referral, use code DN in the first iteration of this loop to indicate the referral received by the rendering provider on this claim. Use code “P3 - Primary Care Provider” in the second iteration of the loop to indicate the initial referral from the primary care provider or whatever provider wrote the initial referral for this patient’s episode of care being billed/reported in this transaction.

 

[1] http://hl7-fhir.github.io/professionalclaim.html

summary: identifier element in MedicationPrescription, MedicationDispense, etc. resources defined with IsModifier flag = true
details:
The identifier element in the MedicationAdministration, MedicationPrescription, MedicationDispense, and MedicationStatement resources are defined with IsModifier flag = true.

But in all other resources the identifier has IsModifier = false.

http://hl7-fhir.github.io/medicationprescription-definitions.html#MedicationPrescription.identifier

http://hl7-fhir.github.io/medicationstatement-definitions.html#MedicationStatement.identifier

  Control                0..*

  Type                     Identifier

  Is Modifier          true

Presumably this is a typo that got propagated to all the Medication resources.

summary: Support multiple referrals on a professional claim
details:
In looking at the professional claim resource [1], it appears that there can only be one referral.  However, the US EDI 5010 837-P supports multiple referrals[2].

I initially logged a change request [3] to the financial working group, but they suggested that the referral resource support this chaining of referrals.

 

[1] http://hl7-fhir.github.io/professionalclaim.html

[2] 2310A — REFERRING PROVIDER NAME Loop Repeat: 2

When there is only one referral on the claim, use code “DN - Referring Provider”. When more than one referral exists and there is a requirement to report the additional referral, use code DN in the first iteration of this loop to indicate the referral received by the rendering provider on this claim. Use code “P3 - Primary Care Provider” in the second iteration of the loop to indicate the initial referral from the primary care provider or whatever provider wrote the initial referral for this patient’s episode of care being billed/reported in this transaction.

[3] http://gforge.hl7.org/gf/project/fhir/tracker/?action=TrackerItemEdit&tracker_id=677&tracker_item_id=3891
The code for EncounterState shouldn't contain a space "in progress" => "inprogress"

Some links under the heading "Content surrounded by [] is mandatory, and will be replaced the string literal identified. Possible insertion values:" point to "resources.html#metadata" instead of "resource.html#metadata".

summary: Java Reference Implementation zip archive missing org.hl7.fhir.instance.model.annotations package
details:
Problem Statement

After downloading the current development version of the Java Reference Implemenation; link: fhir-0.4.0-Java-0.9.zip, I found that I was not able to successfully compile the extracted source code files.  The compilation errors all pointed to missing classes.  For example:

"The import org.hl7.fhir.instance.model.annotations.Block cannot be resolved"

Examination of the zip archive revealed that the Java package "org.hl7.fhir.instance.model.annotations" was not included in the archive.

Corrective Action

I traced the cause of the missing Java package in the fhir /build/tools/java source code to the JavaGenerator class.  Complete SVN path:

http://gforge.hl7.org/svn/fhir/trunk/build/tools/java/org.hl7.fhir.tools.core/src/org/hl7/fhir/tools/implementations/java/JavaGenerator.java

The generate() method logic that adds the required files to the Java zip file was missing the statement needed to add the files for the annotations package.  So, I added the following statement at line 198.  After which my local build process now produces the Java RI zip with the required annotations folder and files.

zip.addFiles(implDir+"org.hl7.fhir.instance"+sl+"src"+ sl+"org"+sl+"hl7"+sl+"fhir"+sl+"instance"+sl+"model"+sl+"annotations"+sl, "org/hl7/fhir/instance/model/annotations/", ".java", null);

I have attached my updated version of the JavaGenerator.java file for review.

summary: missing language, text, contained in composition conent
details: In 6.8 Resource Composition - Content, under section 6.8.3, the composition resource content does not show language, text, and contained elements while in composition XSD definition, these three are valid elements of a composition resource.
Theres a type on the page: CDA R2 Profile should be CDA R2 Conformance Pack

Inv-10 currently:

 provide either a reference or a description (or both) (xpath on f:ElementDefinition/f:binding: (exists(f:referenceUri) or exists(f:referenceResource)) or exists(f:description))

should be

provide either a reference or a description (or both) (xpath on f:ElementDefinition/f:binding: (exists(f:referenceUri) or exists(f:referenceReference)) or exists(f:description))

For token: ":text" (the match does a partial searches on the text portion of a CodeableConcept or the display portion of a Coding), instead of the default search which uses codes. Other define modifiers are ";in", ":below", ":above", ":in" and ":not-in" which are described below

...

Likely the ";in" should be ":not"?

the type.profile element is a uri reference to either a Profile or an ExtensionDefinition. 

Is there a better name to use - eg type.details? type.structure?

At least, the description should be enhanced...

searchParam  are documented as 'Additional search params defined' - but they are not really additional, they are actually 'search parameters implemented by the server - out of all the possible search parameters defined for the resource (or by its profile if there is one)'

~~

summary: Change how delete handles non-existent resources
details:
At present, the delete operation says:

If the resource cannot be deleted because it does not exist on the server, the server SHALL return 404 (Not found). Performing this interaction on a resource that is already deleted has no effect, and should return 204

This is problematic for several reasons:

* It's not idempotent - delete should success if the outcome is that the resource doesn't exist
* what happens when the user isn't allowed to see the resource?
* what about systems that don't track deleted resources?

Better to  just return 204 if the resource doesn't exist after the operation. 

Related changes in bundle/transaction:

* add an invariant that Bundle.entry.status must be missing if  Bundle.entry.deleted is present
* clarify that a transaction that requests to delete a resource that the server doesn't (or cannot) know is not an error (and clarifywhat the return value would be

summary: Remove section 1.13 from the 1.1: Full Table of Contents
details: Section 1.13 (Encounter) and its four sub-sections simply point to the Encounter resource (5.16), and is therefore redundant.

summary: Separate the updateCreate Resource property into an updat and create values
details:
The sub-component Conformance.Rest.Resource has a single property for updateCreate, rather than 2 independant properties. Suggest "update" and "create".

This was possible in the previous DSTU and makes sense where a server permits users to create data, but not update it.

A place where this would be common would be where the data is coming in from a device, and the endpoint is only intended for use by devices that just submit new readings continually.

summary: Change cardnality on Bundle.entry.deleted.versionId and Bundle.entry.deleted.instant to 0..1
details:
After a discussion regarding transaction response handling of deleted resources, the following cardnality changes to the Bundle resource are proposed:

Bundle.entry.deleted.versionId - change cardinality from 1..1 to 0..1 (optional) as this is not really required except on a Bundle.type = transaction-response

Bundle.entry.deleted.instant - change cardinality from 1..1 to 0..1 (optional) as this is not really required except on a Bundle.type = transaction-response

 

Question to Grahame: Do you believe these make sense?

Reply from Grahame: "yes, though they are highly recommended in a history response, and may be necessary in a transaction if doing version safe updates."

summary: Basic resource  is duplicate of Other resource
details: Basic resource  is duplicate of Other resource.  Was other supposed to be renamed?
Contraindication.severity definition incomplete

summary: DeviceComponent should be a class of Device rather than a separate resource
details: DeviceComponent should be a class of Device rather than a separate resource

summary: EpisodeOfCare does not refer to Encounter
details: Althugh stated in the the Boundaries Section  -"...~ while the EpisodeOfCare is the container that can link a series of Enounters together for a specific problem/issue...."  EpisodeOfCare does not refer to Encounter.

summary: Value Set ConditonCertainty doesn't have any codes displayed
details:
Value Set ConditonCertainty doesn't have any codes displayed in HTML page

 

"This value set could not be expanded by the publication tooling: null"

summary: usability issues with "address" as a search parameter for patient
details:
Currently, "address" is listed as a search parameter. I believe that there isn't sufficient information given for implementers regarding how to make this work well for patient queries.

A client application is rarely going to have a single field for user input for "address" rather, the client application may have a field for street address, postal code, city, etc.

From a server standpoint, a system is likely to have more than just one address. Also, attempting a match/filter a set of patient records based on street address lines is something that is unlikely to be supported. Lastly, when used in a search, address information is typically always referring to a patient's usual residence so it would be helpful if the specification made this clear in some way.

Suggestion: break out any address related search parameters to be more specific. etc. Include 1 or 2 of the most common items that might be included in a patient search and then allow individual implementations to add in any additional search parameters. e.g. instead of "address" have e.g. homeCity, homePostalCode.

summary: Description for repeats and required on the question sub-component are copied from group
details:
The description text for the repeats and required properties on the question subcomponent need to be corrected:

required: This question must be answered in the data results, it is a mandatory field

repeats: This question may be answered more than once within this group. Useful for multi-select code selections, or multi-value text items

summary: Resources that have not been approved by work groups should not be in the DSTU 2 Ballot
details: There are many Resources in the for comment Ballot that have not undergone proper review and approved by their prospective WGs.  - for example Communication and CommunicationRequest.   Even though it is a for comment  ballot they should not be part of the ballot and withdrawn from the DSTU until properly reviewed and approved.
Change binding to uc-core-ethnicity  only need the 2  "Hispanic or Latino" and "Not Hispanic or Latino"

change value set for us-core-race to officially recognizes six ethnic and racial categories: White American, Native American and Alaska Native, Asian American, Black or African American, Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander,other race" is also used in the census and other surveys, but is not official.

then this extension can be used as is for US realm profiles

summary: us-core-county and iso21090-ADXP-county are duplicate extensions
details: us-core-county and iso21090-ADXP-county are duplicate extensions they both are extensions on data type address.  I propose 1) picking one and deprecating the other and 2) allowing to be used as either a resource level element (Patient, Organization, etc) and as a datatype extension for address.

summary: Add clarification on case sensitivity in search vs validation
details:
As discussed in Skype implementer chat:

Suppose /ValueSet?code=http%3A%2F%2Fexample.org|CoDe where a given ValueSet defines "code" in the case insensitive system http://example.org.

System is in the path ValueSet.define.system, 
code is in the path     ValueSet.define.concept.code

For normal cases of token search, I can assume system and code on the same element/node of the resource, but not on ValueSet.
For token search, I would expect a 1-to-1 match, but I apparently need to look up every system first to see if it happens to be case-insensitive and adjust my search accordingly. Here I'm looking at ValueSet.define anyway so I already have the object, but in other object searches like Observations I might not.

- Can a server just skip support for caseSensitive in its implementation? I understand there are case insensitive systems out there, but just like systems with white space in their codings I would like to be able to choose to declare those unsupported.

- Also ValueSet?system=X&code=Y and ValueSet?code=X|Y seem to be overlapping. Is one preferred over the other? Both valid?

----

I realize there were actually multiple questions in one here: this ticket is about adding clarification to the search parameter code with regards to case sensitivity (and maybe to token on the search page as well - tokens are not defined to be case sensitive, but I would expect them to be).

summary: Clarification of ho JSON extensions work
details:
The new JSON syntax, FAQ #1 is:

-------------------

I have to initialize superclasses first, so by the time I'm done with my base class, which handles (modifier) extensions, I don't yet know which keys are regular properties and which are extensions. I could solve it by keeping a list of property names in exach class, which would be in addition to having them inside the initializers, but that's not quite nice. Swift currently has almost no reflection capabilities, so there will be a third place to hold hardcoded property names when serialization is done.

So deciding between having a property name list or use XML. Unless – are extensions required to start with "http://" or "https://"? Digging...

------------------

or a variant of this question

Here's the answer

-------

There are 2 cases:

1. You are in a defined FHIR class:
 - any extensions have a ":" in them
- any normal fields don't

2. you are in an extension
- either it has 'value[x]'
- or it's another extension:
  -- ":' means separately defined extension
  -- no ":" means it's a nested extension defined in the same definition

--------------------
this rule is not documented - it has to be derived, so we should state it explicitly

This must have crept in in a search/replace or something, because it certainly wasn't intentional:

POST [base]/[type]/[id]/_meta-delete
POST [base]/[type]/[id]/_history/[vid]/_meta-delete

both should say:

POST [base]/[type]/[id]/_meta/_delete
POST [base]/[type]/[id]/_history/[vid]/_meta/_delete

which is the same as DSTU 1 and what the table a the foot of the page says

Presently, Procedure.followUp is a 0..1 string.  we suggest changing this to a 0..* CodeableConcept.

Rationale:

In the interest of enabling decision support and analytics, coded, structured data should be considered wherever appropriate and practical. In this case, it seems reasonable to use a set of codes for commonly required follow ups. For example, the example in the spec is "removal of sutures". SNOMED has a code for this (Removal of suture (procedure) SCTID: 30549001). In the event that a code is not available for the desired follow up instruction, the text portion of the CodeableConcept can be used.

This rationale seems to have been followed already for Procedure.complication, which is already a 0..* CodeableConcept.

If the element is changed to a CodeableConcept, the cardinality should be changed to 0..*.
The names of the parameter types under 2.1.1.1.3 Search Parameter Types should be hyperlinks to 2.1.1.1.5, 2.1.1.1.6, etc.

summary: Explain how token handles searches against boolean
details: There are a number of search criteria that are intended to search against "boolean" elements.  It would be useful to have some guidance on how searches against boolean are treated - system is optional and, if present, must always be (something?) and the "|[code]" will never return anything because the system is always known.  Or at least something like that.

Presently, Procedure.outcome is a 0..1 string.  We suggest changing this to a 0..1 CodeableConcept.

Rationale:

In the interest of enabling decision support and analytics, coded, structured data should be promoted wherever appropriate and practical. In this case, it seems reasonable to use a set of codes for common outcomes. As a suggestion, the set may be three select values under SNOMED's Modifier mainly for procedure (qualifier value) SCTID: 106239005:

Successful (qualifier value) SCTID: 385669000

Unsuccessful (qualifier value) SCTID: 385671000

Partially successful (qualifier value) SCTID: 385670004

Codes for finer-grained outcomes could also likely be found.

If more detailed and uncodeable information about the outcome is needed, it could either be put in the text portion of the CodeableConcept or in a Procdure.note. Guiding users toward the latter is preferred, since it would lead to more consistent use of Procedure.outcome.

This rationale for using CodeableConcepts seems to have been followed already for Procedure.complication, which is already a 0..* CodeableConcept.

The return body content of the request is undefined, except that it can optionally contain an OperationOutcome.

Grahame's server is now returning the entire resource that was sent so that he can have access to the metadata that is inside.

I agree with the needing to have the metadata, a good use case, but I don't want the whole content echo'd back to me. Especially if I'm on  a mobile device with limitted bandwidth. This would double the bandwidth required to submit content (e.g. large photo of a wound in an observation)

Maybe an inclusion of something.

Also, the text "operationOutcome" should really include hyperlinks to the definition of that resource.

datatype extensions and extensions on extensions failing in validator. 

 

example XML

 

 <address>
<extension url="http://hl7.org/fhir/ExtensionDefinition/iso21090-ADXP-county">

-->

     <system value="https://www.census.gov/geo/reference"/>

summary: Parameter resource does not support parts that are resources
details: The OperationDefinition allows you to define operations which take tuple parameters which can have parts that are resources. However, the Parameters resource only supports parts that are the FHIR datatypes, not resources. Add Parameters.part.resource (of type Resource 0..1)

summary: Tags/Meta and Summary sections of http.html need updating
details: The TOC refers to #tags, but ends up in "Meta Interaction". Ewout mentioned that _meta-delete needs to be _meta/_delete. The summary section towards the bottom of the page is also outdated as it still talks _tags.

summary: Add meta related codes to Security-Event-Sub-Type value set
details:
Could it be that meta is missing for SecurityEvent? http://hl7.org/implement/standards/FHIR-Develop/valueset-security-event-sub-type.html.

Expecting read-meta, vread-meta, update-meta? (can't update), validate-meta? (can you validate the meta?), create-meta, history-meta-instance, history-meta-type, history-meta-system transaction-meta?

summary: Add explanation on how to match a to-be-deleted tag with stored resource meta
details:
When you upload a meta element containing 1..* tags to delete there is a question on how to make the match happen. You could, as a matter of principle, store @id on every tag and require a match on the tags in the request.

Alternatively you could match on system/@value + code/@value, but just like any Coding, it may be a valueSet or something else so matching quickly becomes complicated. In XML you can use deep-equal() to match, but that luxury doesn't apply to JSON.

Having guidance on how to handle is desirable. I think I'm going for @id myself.

summary: Add option to get TagList based on search
details:
Use case: found programming code problems that caused functional corruption in certain resources, e.g. in a given timeframe

To mitigate I obviously need to fix my code, but after that I need to fix the affected resources. To find them I would like access to these paths where the search param is only an example

GET [base]/_meta?_lastUpdated=<2013-01-01
GET [base]/[type]/_meta?_lastUpdated=<2013-01-01

summary: Add option to delete tags for system and type
details:
Use case: found programming code problems that caused functional corruption in certain resources, e.g. in a given timeframe

To mitigate I obviously need to fix my code, but after that I need to fix the affected resources. To delete them I would like access to these paths

POST [base]/_meta/_delete                              Deletes supplied tags on any current resource in the system
POST [base]/_history/_meta/_delete                 Deletes supplied tags on any current/history resource in the system
POST [base]/[type]/_meta/_delete                    Deletes supplied tags on any current resource of the given type
POST [base]/[type]/_history/_meta/_delete       Deletes supplied tags on any current/history resource of the given type
POST [base]/[type]/[id]/_history/_meta/_delete  Deletes supplied tags on any current/history resource of the given type and id

summary: Add link search parameter to Person resource
details: Would like to be able to retrieve a Person resource given one of its linked resources.  For example, if I have a Patient resource, I would like to be able to retrieve the corresponding Person resource to determine other roles this Patient may have.  Currently, Person.link is not defined as a searchable parameter.

summary: Put all "common" parameters into one section
details: "Parameters for all resources" should include the parameters listed under 2.1.1.1.14 Text Search Parameters and 2.1.1.1.15 Advanced filtering too, as those section also define search parameters that apply to all resources.

We have created profiles which are only intended to be used as a base profile for other profiles. We would like to declare this type of profile as an abstract profile; one that is not intended to be used by itself. Please consider adding a property Profile.structure.abstract = true|false.

summary: Reference to ETag on Feed in http doesn't work for Bundles
details: When you search, there is a notion in http.html that you should carry @f:etag on each entry in the Feed. Obviously in DSTU2 there's now a Bundle resource, but that does not have that option. Should it have? At the very least the text in http.html should be updated for DSTU2

summary: Create a new search param type called "uri"
details:
Currently the "token" search parameter type is used for to support search against Codes, CodeableConcepts, Identifiers, and Uris. In this list, "uri" is the odd one out -- because it has no notion of a separate "system" and "code" component as the others do. This makes the search param syntax confusing and ambigious when searching, for example, for a resoruce by profile (like GET /Patient?_profile=Profile/us-realm-person).

The fix: add a new search parameter type, called "uri", which operates a lot like string. (Q. what are the differences between this and string?)

summary: Explain how token-type search params don't necessarily use literal string comparison
details:
I had assumed that I knew how to do matching on token-type search params: when no modifiers are present, I thought it was as simple as performing matching based on (system, code) when both were present, or (code) alone where only a code is present. But apparently this isn't the case. The actual expectations should be clarified (see excerpted Skype discussion from 1/7/2015 below).


[2:47:28 PM] Josh Mandel: I don't see where "[parameter]=[code]" supports partial match, on reading the spec.
[2:48:45 PM] Grahame Grieve: code matching is by meaning, not syntax. We explicitly say that. That's the grounds for partial matching here[2:49:45 PM] Josh Mandel: "Code matching is by meaning"? I don't know how to interpret that statement, or where to find it in the spec... It would be nice to have an algorithm here.

[2:54:13 PM] Grahame Grieve: Josh: the specification cannot prevent people from doing useful things just because it can't be proscribed in advance algorithmically

[2:54:43 PM] Josh Mandel: @Grahame: Not sure where you're going with this comment. You said "code matching is by meaning, not syntax. We explicitly say that", and I'm simply asking... where/how do we explictly say it?
[2:55:35 PM] Grahame Grieve: actually, we don't. I thought we did, but I've just read the section again, and I see that we don't actually say that
[2:56:02 PM] Grahame Grieve: "value matches" is the words we use, and we intended that to mean that this is logical equivalence testing, not literal equivalence testing
[2:56:37 PM] Josh Mandel: Okay -- I'd call that intention "implicit" -- but agree that it should be made explicit.
[2:57:11 PM] Grahame Grieve: so, yes, agree that it is implicit, and it should be explicit

summary: add a new value to the issue type valueset
details:
It has been suggested that teh OperationOutcome resource be used to notify a client that a result bundle may be incomplete due to provacy restrictions enforced by the server.

In v3, the equivalent structure to OperationOutcome included a code called SUPPRESSED with the definition "One or more records in the query response have been suppressed due to consent or privacy restrictions."  

recommend that a similar code be added to the FHIR value set.

summary: Operation example (showing vs expansion) uses incorrect parameter name
details: This example uses a parameter "valueset", but according to the definition here http://hl7.org/implement/standards/FHIR-Develop/valueset-operations.html, the parameter is called "valueSet"

summary: Value Set  Substance Type has display error
details:
Value Set Substance Type HTML page shows the following error:

"This value set could not be expanded by the publication tooling: org.hl7.fhir.instance.model.OperationOutcome cannot be cast to org.hl7.fhir.instance.model.ValueSet (2)"

summary: Suggest to add :not capability to string search
details:
Just noticed that search type string doesn't have a :not modifier. How would you search for name:exact:not=eve or name:not=eve?

Suggest to add :not capability in some fashion to string search

In the following text: "the original sender matches the response to the request based on the MessageHeader.id, and so an active intermediary that choose the re-initiate a query that it previously relayed cannot change the MessageHeader.identifier"

I assume "MessageHeader.id" should say "MessageHeader.identifier".

http://hl7-fhir.github.io/operations.html has a link titled "Asynchronous Messaging" that points to http://hl7-fhir.github.io/message.html#asynchronous. It should point to messaging.html (with "ing").

summary: Additional validation needed for profiles in FHIR publishing tooling
details:
Some FHIR profiles in continuous integration build and developmental version contain errors that are not caught in the current FHIR publishing/validation tools.

1. observation-daf-vitalsigns-dafvitalsigns

Profile defines element Observation.referenceRange.meaning of type "CodeableCondept" rather than "CodeableConcept" which is defined in the base resource. This is clearly a typo resulting in an invalid type which is not caught and the profile gets published with the error.

2. observation-daf-vitalsigns-dafvitalsigns

    Element: Observation.identifier

    base type: Identifier

    profile element type: id - typo and incompatible type

3. encounter-daf-dafencounter.profile.xml

    Element: Encounter.location.location

    base type = Reference(Location)

    profile element type: Location - typo and invalid type

summary: The display for Namespace.category looks like it's an enumeration, even though it isn't.
details: Change this to say E.g. with commas instead of vertical bars.  I.e. "E.g. driver, provider, patient, bank" instead of "driver | provider | patient | bank"
There's no search parameter for Composition.encounter. There's many use cases for this, and openMRS needs it. We should create it

summary: Revert JSON extension mechanism to representation defined in v0.0.82 (DSTU1)
details:
One of the goals of the FHIR specification was to simplify implementation and align with existing tools.  Early on several changes were made to simply things like implementation in .NET technologies.

In DSTU1, JSON object mappers such as Jackson or Moxy can easily be used to map java beans where the extensions are easily stored in the extension property of a java bean, defined as an array of "url" and "value" properties.  In the proposed changes, that is no longer the case, to generically represent extenstions one would need to directly parse JSON and extract the extension information and repackage it.  While this proposed representation may be more compact, it makes implmenentation much more difficult.

summary: Make support of Get for search optional
details: This is a request to allow compliant servers that support search to only accept POST requests for searches to avoid the possibility of PHI or PII ending up in logs.  It is considered industry practice that sensitive information should not be included in GET requests to avoid the possibility of it ending up in logs.  Arbitrary searches may contain PHI or PII.

summary: org.hl7.fhir.instance.model.DateAndTime crashes at parsing dataTimes with zero values for fraction of second.
details:
org.hl7.fhir.instance.model.DateAndTime crashes at parsing dataTimes with zero values for fraction of second. e.g. "2014-12-23T19:48:44.000".

The culprit is line 296 in method setFraction(int fraction) which seems to have a typo in the if condition. Seems like it should be corrected to:

if (this.fractions == 0)

  throw new Exception("set 'fractions' before setting 'fraction'");

summary: XmlParser.parseGeneral() breaks on resources with more than 1 contained resources.
details: XmlParser.parseGeneral() breaks on resources with more than 1 contained resources. The culprit is line 800 of org.hl7.fhir.instance.formats.XmlParser in method parseResourceContent() which parses only one contained resource (the code seems a little bit messed up around that line). I fixed this by replacing that line with a while loop which keeps parsing until the <contained> tag is closed.

summary: Profile XML files are missing profile declarations for extensions
details: The table display is rendering ok, but when you look in the XML, the type is just "Extension" instead of declaring a profile that points to the extension definition.

summary: Narrative status isn't showing full enumeration
details: Missing "empty" (and not sure why the build process isn't complaining . . .)

summary: Enforce that narrative exists for resources pointed to by composition sections
details:
Add a constraint with a context of Composition.section.content with the following xpath:

f:reference[contains(@value, ':') or (contains(@value, '#') and ancestor::f:Composition/f:contained/f:*[f:id/@value=substring-after(current()/@value, '#')]/f:text) or ancestor::f:Composition/parent::f:resource/parent::f::entry/parent::f:Bundle/f:entry/f:resource/*[f:id/@value=substring-after(current()/@value, '/')]/f:text]

English version: resources pointed to by sections must have narrative

summary: Ensure that all FHIR value sets meet VSD minimum requirements
details:
The FHIR specification publishes many value sets (800+) at the moment. The FHIR value set is loose - has a minimal set of required elements, consistent with it'swide usage, especially for enumerations. We also defined a "Shareable ValueSet profile" that expresses the requirements that HL7 will impose for value sets that are shared through HL7 registries. This is based on the VSD project. 

The FHIR build tool should validate all the value sets in the project (except possibly some special example ones) against the shareanle value set profile to ensure that they meet minimum HL7 standards. 

Note: some modifications to existing value sets, inluding the MIF, maybe required?
Section numbers are as important here as anywhere else.

summary: Inappropriate period in front of profile definition
details: It seems to be a general tooling error.  E.g. ". Defines constraints and extensions on the AllergyIntolerance resource "

summary: Summary view in profiles is inappropriate
details: The summary view that lists what's mandatory, what the bindings are, etc. is verbose and is redundant with what's in the table views.  It's a throwback to the CDA implementation guide style, is ugly and shouldn't be included in the FHIR publication.  It serves no useful purpose to express in long sentences what can be seen at a glance in the table view more easily and it just adds that much more scrolling before you can get to the table view.

summary: Links in table views from names to definitions aren't working properly
details: E.g. for status, the link target is: http://hl7-fhir.github.io/allergyintolerance-daf-dafallergyintolerance-definitions.html#U.S. Data Access Framework (DAF) AllergyIntolerance Profile.AllergyIntolerance.null

summary: Sliced elements not showing up in definitions
details: If an element appears in a row in the table view, I'd expect there to be a corresponding link in the definition view
coding is sliced based on system according to the spreadsheet, but that's not displayed anywhere in the differential view.

summary: Extensions should not inherit *any* content from the base definition of extension
details: For example, Observation.extension(USLabSpecimenRejectReason) is showing aliases and comments from the base definition of extension.  If a given extension definition doesn't include aliases or comments, then the element should have no aliases or comments, it shouldn't inherit the ones from the base definition of extension.  Also, I'm not seeing the vocabulary binding for USLabSpecimenRejectReason, even though it has one.

summary: Extension references should include a hyperlink to the extension definition (and the URL)
details: E.g. Observation.extension(USLabSpecimenRejectReason)
An error should have been generated because of the declaration of a binding for Patient.address.state

It would be useful to be able to filter on surgery vs. education vs. other types of procedures.  Not all systems will recognize the procedure codes and be able to easily filter.  Declaring that when authoring (which can often be inferred from context) would make it easier to accesss relevant information.

summary: "Other definitions: (todo)" should be removed or fixed
"This value set is not currently used" is not taking into account usage in profiles
Two ways to say Condition doesn't exist
details: The value set for certainty includes the notions of "known absent, not suspected, known possible, probably present and definitely present".  These overlap with the notions in status of "provisional, working, confirmed and refuted".  Such an overlap isn't ok.  The value set for certainty (even if just an example) needs to be orthogonal to the value set for status such that any combination of status and certainty makes sense.

summary: Inv-7 incorrectly defined for the ValueSet
details:
The definition of the Inv-7 Constraint does not work when the identifier is not provided in a valueset defintion.

Lloyd suggests that fix is:

or not(f:define/f:system/@value = f:identifier/@value)

summary: Unclear how do search using messaging
details:
Now Query has disappeared, it's unclear how to send a Query using messaging.

Section 2.1.1.5 here (http://hl7.org/implement/standards/FHIR-Develop/search.html) will describe this usecase for you, however this section is not finished yet. It will be based on the way operations are invoked asynchronously (see 2.2.0.5 here http://hl7.org/implement/standards/FHIR-Develop/operations.html). This section is also sketchy. I will take this up with Grahame and Lloyd to flesh it out.

summary: SearchParameters should be distributed in validation.zip
details: The validation.zip should contain a Bundle with all SearchParameter resources, as is available separately on http://hl7.org/implement/standards/FHIR-Develop/search-parameters.xml

summary: USLab Profiile - consider using data-absent-reason for key data elements
details: USLab Profiile - consider requiring support of data-absent-reason extension for key data elements ( example patient name)  See how DAF will handle this and consider the CLIA fields.

summary: Terminology Bindings for U.S. Extension SNOMED-CT
details: Need to be able to use the US Extension SNOMED terms or other local terms in FHIR resources.

Scheduled - Timing/Period 0..1

This appears to be viable for the use case of an oral diet and oral nutrition supplement needing to be changed to satisfy an NPO order.

Scheduled - Timing/Period 0..1

Include Scheduled - Timing/Period 0..1 with each of the main components of the Nutrition Order (oral diet, supplement, enteralformula)

Need to be able to schedule the components separately.  Is there a way that both the existing representation and separate schedules can be done?

Product Name more clearly represents intent and differentiates it from Supplement -Type

Product Name more clearly represents intent and differentiates it from baseformulatype

Existing Wording: Additive -  additivename

Proposed Wording: "additivename" with "additive productname"

Comments: Product Name more clearly represents intent and differentiates it from additiveType

Proposed Wording: Hospitalization - diet

Does not appear this resource will align with the NutritionOrder Resource.  Could this be changed to map to the NutritionOrder resource?
